Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Cozy...”
Reviews.Author: NomadinUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Taj for 3 nights in a junior suite with fireplace. Absolutely loved the quaint and cozy feature of a wood burning fireplace. One quick call to the fireplace "butler" ensured that our fire did not go it. It was great being able to choose what type of wood you wanted from the menu--the Butler recommended the Taj Blend which was a little bit of everything--just lovely. The hotel was quiet and comfortable and was in an ideal location. Directly across from the park, Beacon Hill and plenty of shopping around. Molten Brown amenities were lovely and the bed linens, and towels were soft and comfortable We did have room service once and the food was hot and delivered quickly--not always the case in many hotels. Brunch in the Cafe was excellent--staff fell over themselves to make sure we were satisfied. Some of the furniture was a bit dated, but the room was very clean. I would stay at this Taj again--it made our weekend stay in Boston memorable and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Classy without being snooty”
Reviews.Author: BigEGentle
Reviews.Content: Had a great one night stay on business. I checked in at 3:00 pm and my room wasn't ready so they immediately offered me an upgrade to a city view from (I was originally booked for an interior view). The room was tastefully furnished. It felt a tiny bit older (like the furnishings hadn't been updated in a while). However, it was more than adequate. The Molton Brown toiletries are excellent and, in my opinion, smell better than the over-the-top Bulgari soaps that the Ritz stocks. Warm staff, comfortable room, nice smell goods, and a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “old world boston charm”
Reviews.Author: sueytraveler
Reviews.Content: The Taj in Boston is a lovely hotel with exceptionally friendly, not stuffy, service. We were treated well by the valet, bell boy, check in, and concierge. The deluxe city view room is not huge but certainly adequate for two. Very comfortable bed. The bathroom is petite but nicely appointed. The location is the best in the city..right on Newbury Street and the Public Garden. The breakfast in the cafe is pricey but delicious. I thought for the money ($234 on a Sat. night in March), it was a good deal. I would stay here again in a heart-beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: chia00
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and accomidating. Only advise is make sure there isn't construction out side your room, we moved to a park side room with no problem sure to construction. But the people are so helpful and it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nardiesally
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, right off Boston Common and off the shopping district. I paid $179/night on Hotwire, which worked out to be $217. The hotel is old and has a lot of style. The rooms are small especially the bathroom. I initially had a room overlooking the shopping district. Owing to a jackhammer, I was moved to a view of Boston Common. Great room. Service was terrific. I would certainly stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem overlooking Public Gardens.”
Reviews.Author: LeoKri
Reviews.Content: A great cozy place in the best part of Boston. My friend and I came to do some major shopping in Boston. Don't know if we enjoyed the Taj or shopping more. The room was absolutely beautiful, the staff could not do enough for us. What a pleasure to stay at such a fine hotel. Of course, during the summer overlooking the Public Gardens must be even more magical.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneMaureen2011
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Taj Boston was a really good experience. We had a lovely room overlooking the park. The staff were most helpful and very polite. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but missing a certain je ne sais quoi...”
Reviews.Author: Livingthedreamco
Reviews.Content: The taj is without a doubt a beautiful hotel in the best possible location in Boston, but is definitely missing something to make it the best. The staff although friendly is lazy. The door is never opened and we had to carry our shopping bags when we got out of the car. The room service was atrocious. I have to give the breakfast credit, it had the best food I have ever had and the eggs benedict were holy. The rooms need an urgent technological renovation. the phones and the bathrooms are old. You wouldn't expect this from a LHW (leading hotels in the world) hotel. We were staying at a junior suite with a spectacular fire place. It is a shame that the rooms were outdated, it ruins the whole illusion of perfection. It is a great hotel but it just didn't live up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “White Glove service”
Reviews.Author: annaorysia
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Boston Park Plaza down the street but this year for the same money received the same price for the TAJ. What a wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, wonderful service. I will never go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Ritz”
Reviews.Author: oneLmichele1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when it was the Ritz. I was in a fireplace suite. The service was great a bit staid though. Now, Taj took it over and wow, unpretentious class. We were in a premium room which was spacious and clean as a whistle. The furniture was appointed well. Michael at the front desk worked his magic because he wanted to and it is what he does best Lynn was also excellent. Everyone was wonderful and genuinely smiling! Only wrinkle was the phone help. Whether I called to get the shoes shined or a bottle of champagne, the people on the receiving line were not up to par with the face to face help. The restaurant was quite good.Try the crabcake benedict or the Madame sandwich. The wait staff and managers were fab! Location, best in Boston. You are on the corner of Newbury and Arlington. You are across the street from the park. We will try to stay no where else when we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Sample The Good Life At The Taj”
Reviews.Author: Bobnkathye
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. If you have the need to feel pampered and important this is the place to go. We stayed in a Fireplace Suite where you are actually given a menu to choose the type of wood you prefer at no cost. Located at the corner of Arlington and Newbury streets you are surrounded by stores such as Hermes, Valentino and Georgio Armani. Great restaurants on Newbury. The bar at the hotel is cozy with a large fireplace. We can't wait to book our next visit. Book two nights an get the third night free.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rentim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, on the corner of Newbury Street and Arlington...great shopping and dining. We were able to check in at around 10:30 am, so that was nice. The hotel itself is fine. Our room was a little small and the bathroom was very small. Shower had incredible hot water with heavy pressure, which I like. Molton Brown bath products. The sheets are Frette, wonderful, I think I am going to order a set. The bed was very comfortable. My husband hates down pillows, I thought these down pillows were maybe the best ones I have ever slept on. The hotel is pretty quiet, not much going on. It is hard to compare hotels in a city when you have only been to one hotel so far but the price was great at a little over $200 for what the hotel offers. We did not eat in the restaurants, but the dining room looked cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, view, location”
Reviews.Author: kgirltoday
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before. Compared to a few years back the place seemed upgraded and improved in many ways. This time we were only here for one night but the stay was perfect. Our view was magnificent and the service here was fabulous. The room was perfectly clean. The staff could not have been nicer and more friendly and welcoming. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. I would strongly recommend a stay here for anyone wanting a calm lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kberley
Reviews.Content: Only had one night at the Taj but everything was perfect! Location, staff, room, and amenities cannot be beat in Boston. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect it to be a 5-star experience”
Reviews.Author: kongju21
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in for 1 night expecting the same service we received at the Taj in Mumbai & Delhi a few weeks earlier. Not even close. We arrived with bags in hand - no one opened the doors - valet watched us struggle and then when we got to reception we thought a bellboy would come right over to help us. No such luck. Typically not a problem but we had so many bags and we were just so exhausted from the day when we arrived to the hotel. We got in our room and the first thing we noticed was how outdated the rooms were and strangely the furniture was placed. The TV was placed to the left of the bed, not centered. The shower had shower curtains instead of doors so that instantly grossed out the hubby. Since we were so tired, we looked out the window (fantastic view of the park) and then went to sleep In the morning, we noticed that the water in the tub was not draining and the TV was not working. We called the front desk - they said that they would send an engineer over right away - no one ever came. When we complained to the manager, she said that they would definitely look into it for the next guest. What about us? It wasn't as relaxing as we hoped, not worth the money, and definitely does not live up to the Taj name. We got food at the bar for lunch - staff seemed bored and one of the servers in the bar kept looking out the window. Manager really needs to step up to the plate to make this hotel a 5 star experience from managing staff better to making the rooms nicer as it is absolutely not at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: BanajiMumbai
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel seeveral times on business trips varying from a few days to a couple of weeks. This hotel has Boston Bhramin written in it's DNA. Arguably the hotel with the most illustrious history in the city( the likes of Winston Churchill have stayed here), it reeks of old world charm and old time breeding. It is fitting that the taj group of India have taken over this hotel from the Ritz Carlton group - for there is perhaps no chain of hotels in the world that understands the meaning of "Heritage" more than this group. The suites( room numbers ending with 09) have working fireplaces with a "fireplace menu" that comprises of your choice of several types of wood. And believe me nothing is more welcoming than a crackling fire in the midst of a sub zero Boston winters evening. Room numbers ending with 31 are large corner rooms overlooking the Boston public gardens and Commonwealth Ave. Stunning from the higher floors. The staff are always friendly and welcome you by Your name. There are some staff left over from the Ritz days that have not yet imbibed the meaning of Taj hospitality. If you are a club member, then you have access to one of the finest rooms you will ever be privileged to enter - the club lounge on the 15 th floor with magnificent views of the Boston skyline and the park below. You can have breakfast lunch and dinner here, whilst you gaze out at the wonderful view outside. I have not decided which is the better view... Boston in winter or that in summer.I have spent many a restful hour in this room working,reading or just drinking coffee in hushed silence. I have also stayed in many other hotels in Boston bur absolutely nothing comes close to the Taj.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price but Property Really Needs Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: dicooley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here many times, both when it was the Ritz and as the Taj, most recently in Nov 2011. The last few times we have stayed there I have said this one will be the last, the rooms are just getting too funky but the outstanding price and location keeps luring us back. I'm from Boston and I can say with confidence this is the best location in the city. As far as prices go, the last time we stayed here our room was $250 and we got a large suite overlooking the public garden; that kind of price just doesn't exist anywhere else (although the Eliot Hotel is also very reasonable and nice, sans the view). Those are the goods, here come the bads and they're pretty bad. The couch in our room had nasty stains all over it, I tried to turn the cushions but the other sides were stained also. It was so bad I was afraid to sit on it so I had to put towels on it. Even though our suite was large, there was only a sofa and one chair for furniture in the parlor area. When we got rooms service we didn't have two chairs to sit at, which was really awkward because the sofa was low and, as mentioned, not someplace where I wanted to sit. The carpeting was also stained and I'm not talking about small stains.The bedroom was fine, if a little small and chilly (the rooms seem to have forced heat and our bedroom never felt warm) and the bathroom was also fine, nothing special (though Molton Brown products are always nice). Just outside of our room there was a large section of the wall that was water damaged and all the wallpaper was peeled off, it was nasty. I guess in the end, my feeling is I would rather pay more for a nicer property. (PS: Service is very good, particularly valet, but one night we came back to our room and there were four people in there, which was a little unsettling. When we asked what they were all doing we were told they were bringing us our amenity--two thanksgiving cupcakes--why did this take four people?? I think maybe they were watching a soccer game or something).

Reviews.Title: “Great Club Level”
Reviews.Author: RIBluebird
Reviews.Content: We did a last minute getaway through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts. We booked a club level room. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The club level had great food preparations and alcoholic beverages were included. I loved the afternoon "tea" service on the club level. It was wonderful to sit and look out over the Public Garden. The service in the hotel was bar was just okay. They were a bit slow. The location was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs renovations to really be top notch”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: The location of the TAJ is fantastic and the prices are good for views of the pretty Boston public garden. It doesn't compare though when looking at the Mandarin Oriental or Four Seasons (or even some of the smaller new hotels in town). The rooms are definitely showing their age - in our room there was something drawn on the wall (red marker) behind the door that someone had clearly tried to erase but could still be seen. Carpets are faded, furniture is really dinged up (look down at the tables in the restaurants). And although prices are good there are lots of extra charges.. they charge for using the internet for every device (phone, ipad, computer etc.) that is used. And it's not clearly spelled out anywhere in the room. There's no complimentary water like the Four Seasons .. so you use the mini bar etc.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: anthony604
Reviews.Content: The Taj is in a great position. This is a fine hotel in the old style. We had a great view. The bathroom was small, with no separate shower, Moulton Brown products which we like. We had a light lunch in the coffee shop which was good with charming service. The bar in the evening was buzzy - so buzzy in fact that we could not get a table for six people so had to leave. Would definitely stay again again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: fungrltraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Taj Hotel and although I absolutely loved our room with the fireplace, I was disappointmented with the food. I ordered the crabcake which was supposed to be served over a bed of greens. The crab was fishy and it was served with a side of finely julienne cut veggies...hardly a salad. I had also tried the soup of the day, which was a tomato bisque. It was flavorless. For the exhorbitant prices, the food should be much, much better. I would recommend eating elsewhere. Everything else about the hotel was lovely. The location is very convenient, the bar room was one of my favorite places to have a drink...very very cozy, and the staff was pleasant. We were not able to get the club access as it was full, but I am certain that makes the stay exceptional. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Taj Boston”
Reviews.Author: Jean543
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I had an extremely enjoyable and comfortable stay at the Taj Boston in October. I want to write about our wonderful experience as I was very pleasantly surprised with the hotel, having read many negative reviews about it earlier on Trip Advisor, and I wasn't quite sure what to expect. A very warm welcome awaited me when I arrived early morning, and the reception staff obliged by giving me a room as soon as possible, which was really very welcome. The lobby and reception areas are charming with and an old world ambiance, yet classy and elegant. My twin bedded room was very quiet, spacious, bright and airy, and had a lovely view of the park. There were two huge, comfortable double beds and ample storage space. All the furnishings were neat and clean and looked fairly new. The bathroom was actually two rooms, one being a huge dressing room with washbasin, and the other with a large tub and WC. I did not experience any problems with the plumbing as mentioned in some of the reviews. Our reservation was one which included access to the Taj Club, which one can opt for at the time of booking on the website.The breakfast and snacks served in the Taj Club Lounge were replenished continuously and were delicious, especially in the evening the evening and there was a wide range of foods from seafood starters, to sushi and grilled meats. Mercedes, the lady in charge there, was also very warm and welcoming. I had ordered room service for dinner one night, and the meal portions were tasty, huge and fairly reasonably priced. Finally, last but most importantly, the hotel has one of the best locations in the city, at the beginning of Newbury St., which is one of the main shopping and restaurant streets in downtown Boston. You can walk to many of the sites from the hotel, but there is also an underground subway station which is a two minute walk away from the hotel, and taxis are readily available outside. I strongly recommend this hotel to visitors wanting to stay at the doorstep of the city's main attractions, while experiencing the old world charm and elegance of this bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel if you have club access”
Reviews.Author: rvkummer
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of Christmas (4 days). Hotel is charming and elegant. The bar is beautiful albeit expensive (welcome to Boston). The room is nice, but average. The comments about the bathroom size is a bit exagerated, the bathroom was sized fine and very elegant. It's an old hotel so you do not get a seperate tub, but that is really not a big deal. I would have liked a TV in the bathroom - could really help set this hotel apart. I found the staff a bit cool everywhere except in the club. Upon arrival, the door was not opened (why do these places have doormen, they look at you and kind of just stand there). It was kind of funny because we lugged all our bags up to the front desk to check in and I asked if the hotel's bellmen were all on break, (I had had a lousy and unexpected all day flight from LA and was in a sarcastic mood) the gal at the desk said no, I just looked down at the bags we had just carted in and just smiled. The reservation was a bit messed up, but was resolved quickly. If you stay here, stay on the club level, or at least ask for club access. It is like the Ritz club, but a beautiful view and very elegant / comfy atmoshere to spend some time snacking or drinking. There is a full bar (unlike the Ritz which has just wine at cocktail hour) which seems available all day. Breakfast is a full meal (without hot food) and the evening appetizers can easily serve as a meal if you get tired of going out. I would probobly not stay at the hotel again without being on club level.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner in the Taj Cafe.”
Reviews.Author: SingingSeagull
Reviews.Content: A Saturday evening dinner at about 6pm and very pleasant. We had reservations for a window table. Food exquisite and service spot on. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Sad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Autumn N
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Taj Hotel in Boston for my brotherâ€™s wedding and I have to say I was shocked at what a sad little hotel it is. Granted it is very old, but rather than honing in on its classic elegance, they have chosen to allow it to be simply dated. We stayed in a Luxury suite and sadly, not so luxurious. The carpets were worn and stained. The couch was actually dirty. I was mortified to have my children on it. The drapes were dingy. I had called ahead to ensure that we would have a crib, fridge, roll away bed and iHome delivered to our room and were told we would be all set. When we got there we had none of them which resulted in having to call multiple times to have them delivered. The staff was very pleasant, however it was like grand central for almost and hour with people coming in and out when all we wanted to do was settle the kids in and relax. I agree with the other comments regarding the tub, the drainage was terrible. The bedding that they provided with the crib was awful, granted I brought my own blankets, but I could not believe that they actually thought it would be acceptable to roll up washcloths to put in the edges of the crib to act as a bumper. The elevators are terribly slow and there was one out of service, which only left two servicing all floors. They are very small elevators and we were there with a stroller so many times my husband and I would have to split up due to others already in. At one point I waited thirty-five minutes just to get to the lobby from my floor. Then upon check out we called the thirty minutes ahead of time for our vehicle and ended up waiting almost forty-five. I was very disappointed and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: iamamsterdam
Reviews.Content: I'm a Bostonian, who lives in the city, and had the opportunity to stay at this hotel this past weekend. I love being able to wake up right-smack in the middle of the city, especially across from such a lovely place this time of year - Public Gardens. Small but comfortable room with a decent view. Service was great, check-in super easy. I found the lobby and elevators to be a little on the tight side, but such is usually the case with older, more historic hotels. The best part: uber comfortable pillows and bedding!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: MaryHogan
Reviews.Content: Great location on the corner of Newbury and Arlington St. You can walk anywhere. Room was pretty, although the didn't completey repair some water damage on the ceiling (maybe left over from our terrible winter last year.) The negative is there is NO sound separation between rooms if there is a connecting door. We got to hear the entire drunken argument between the young couple next door. Not so much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone feels like a VIP!”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhoteldiva
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this hotel since I was a child and the hotel was the RC. I have continued to patronize it because of the location and genuine beauty of the building. Our most recent stay over Thanksgiving was truly special. The hotel team went out of their way to make staying at the Taj much better than being home for Thanksgiving. Many of the staff members have been there for years. They know how to treat their guests and to make a holiday a special occasion. Our room was lovely and had a fireplace. Boston is known for its charm, and the Taj has embraced the charm and spirit of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, mediocre room”
Reviews.Author: susan robin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here once or twice a year for the past six or seven years, through the transition from Ritz Carlton to Taj. The pluses: location and service are fabulous, excellent breakfast and lively bar scene with good drinks. The minuses: our king sized room had a bathroom that was beyond tiny. And for this price, are we not past cloth shower curtains, really? A rush pressing of my husband's suit and shirt was $26, that shocks even us jaded New Yorkers. The rooms need a MAJOR redo, they are looking tired. Nicked furniture, worn carpets. And screaming infant in the adjacent room would have been a huge issue except parents got the kid to stop after 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect anniversary visit”
Reviews.Author: orleyfarm
Reviews.Content: Elegant old Boston landmark. Very helpful, competent, friendly staff from check-in to departure. Junior suite on a high floor. Spectacular view of the Commons. Traditional decor and furnishings Delicious breakfast served in suite. Amenities to honor anniversary delivered on arrival. Beautiful linens et al. Immaculate and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Big price tag for a little sparkle”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a decent centrally located hotel for a 1 night stay. The lobby is lovely, the staff was pleasant. The bed was terrible and we had to be up early to get to the airport. Upon attempting to take a shower we found that it was unpleasantly tepid. No "hot" water to speak of. So, if you care about sleeping or showering, perhaps this is not the place for you. But, if you like ambiance and location, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Wulfie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night city break in Boston, staying at the Taj, we were a bit sceptical about the Taj given some of the recent more negative reviews on TA. In Summery Location is great We had no problems checking in Staff were attentive without being overbearing Room was very large, with a good size bathroom, if a little dated in it's decoration, YES our view was not great, but we dont spend our days staring out of the bedroom window! We ate in the bar and took tea at 4 o'clock (we are afterall ENGLISH) also in the bar, can have no complaints. Overall a positive experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with great location.”
Reviews.Author: barinr
Reviews.Content: We spent a night during a slow period on a Vacationist offering. We had a very pleasant Junior Suite that was pleasantly furnished with working fireplace. There is a menu of woods available that are delivered and lighted by the staff with 20 minutes notice. No extra charge. The bedroom was equally pleasant. The bed was nice but not the best I ever climbed into. The bath was marble, nice with a deep tub. The shower did not work, but I mentioned it to the front desk upon checkout and they eagerly assured me that it would be taken care of promptly. The hotel feels old line, not contemporary, but our room was comfortable; the heating/AC worked well. There were signs of wear and tear which would have been more objectionable at full price. Now to the bar. It's great. Not cheap, but it is comfortable and is one of the best I've found in Boston. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't comment. But the staff, with one exception, were very pleasant. The exception, one front desk clerk, but the hotel does seem to be trying to counter some of the bad press.

Reviews.Title: “Best position in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Atric
Reviews.Content: Had a great couple of nights here in November. We travelled as a small group and were treated handsomely throughout our stay. The hotel is situated directly across from The Public Garden and Boston Common and on the edge of Newbury Street with its designer shops and bistros.try and get a high floor room with views out over the Public Gaaaden, particularly if you are travelling in the fall. The views are very pleasant indeed. Although expensive to eat at the hotel, it is defintely worth the extra you pay. The standards of service we encountered during our stay were also of the highest calibre and we were suitably impressed. if I have one criticism, it is that some of the rooms are in need of a facelift, but I couldn't fault them for comfort (the beds are really comfortable) or cleanliness. I will most definitely be back when I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “A Boston GEM!!”
Reviews.Author: CTNewEnglander75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from another fabulous stay at the Taj Boston. We had a corner room with an entry hall. The front desk staff could not have been more courteous or helpful...as were the bellmen, concierge, and Taj Club staff. The views of the park from our room were sensational. This hotel is a keeper! We cannot recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in Boston”
Reviews.Author: lac555
Reviews.Content: As stated in other reviews, I generally like modern and contemporary hotels. That said, we spent a very enjoyable six nights At the Taj Boston (Business and Pleasure). The hotel is the former Ritz and lives up to the elegance of a Ritz and now Taj reputation. Boston has many areas so it is hard to say what is the best. It all depends on what you are looking to do. The Taj is in Back Bay, overlooking the Public Gardens and the Commons. Great location for shopping and business. It is on the corner of Newbury Street which has some great shopping and galleries. It is walkable to the business center and walkable to the waterfront/North Bay on a nice day or a short cab ride. The Taj is what you expect from an older, traditionial hotel. Excellent service and staff (although the reception area was always a bit of a cluster) with lots of friendly, efficient, and helpful staff. Room service was quick and the food was hot, and The Bar was comfortable and relaxing after meetings and shopping. We had a room with a park view. It was amazing with the fall colors. I highly recommend requesting a park view. An associate was there and had an air conditioner view. The view definitely added to the experience. The bedroom was fairly large for an old hotel. A pleasant surprise was the lighting in the room. One of my biggest complaints is the lighting in most hotels is not bright enough to work. The room was very bright. The two downsides were the small size of the bath room and the lack of outlets near the desk. The bathroom was tiny! Older hotels have small bathrooms, but this was one of the smallest I have had in quite some time. You could not fit more than one person in at a time, truly tiny. On the plugs, in todays world of lap top, mobile phones, iPads, etc, we need outlets. There were only two near the desk without unpluging a light. While these were inconveniences, they are not deal breakers and wouldn't prevent me from staying there. My only complaint would be some of the wear and tear. The carpet was filthy and stained, and the comforter and sheets were torn. You expect wear and tear at all hotels, but I do expect a higher standard at the Tag. All the above said, I highly recommend the Taj if you are in that area of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no free Internet”
Reviews.Author: FatherMckenzie
Reviews.Content: I could not give more than three stars because it makes me crazy when hotels charge for the Internet. Our room was spacious, comfortable, and clean and the bed was excellent. The location is great right near shopping and the commons.

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay in Boston Taj, good and not so good!”
Reviews.Author: kilmac15
Reviews.Content: 3 adults in a 3 bed room and more or less what we expected. Didn't dine in the restaurant and only had snacks and drinks in the bar. Bar very nice and excellent service, lovely at night looking out on the common and the watching the world go by. Went to Paramount diner locally for breakfast and that was ab fab. Bedroom very nice and comfortable beds, shower needs modernising. room very clean and no complaints only compliments about housekeeping. James, concierge was super, extremely helpful and great recommendations on restaurants, made our bookings and sorted us on shopping and tourist interests. Requested early morning taxi (6a.m.)taxi night before departure, didn't happen, had to flag a taxi ourselves. Luggage was brought to foyer and not to front door, had to retrieve it ourselves and carry it to taxi, totally unsatisfactory. not sure website images match what's real, didn't see on the ground what we expected, more virtual than real???? Location is the best, great to stroll across the common, really beautiful to visit in October. Don't think it is 5 star, maybe 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Atila-the-Hunn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior suite over looking the Commons. The fireplace added to the room's elegance and romance. The King bed had a Down Comfortor which made the bed super comfortable. The staff was nice, friendly and helpful. The morning we checked out they had actually forgotten to put our luggage in the trunk. We did not notice and drove away to Cambrigde for breakfast. They notified us and immediately drove it to us at the restaurant we were eating at....Now that's service!

Reviews.Title: “If you cannot stay at XV Beacon....”
Reviews.Author: beth06
Reviews.Content: perfect location for walking, running, and shopping....very nice Molton Brown amenities in bath and bed is perfectly comfortable! Not as nice and modern a vibe as XV Beacon but for an old world hotel it is very nice.......way nicer than the Elliot!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room but not 5 star service all around”
Reviews.Author: Done_with_shoveling
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay last minute and thus paid a pretty penny for our executive 1 bedroom with a fireplace. I booked the Fireplace Package as that seems like a nice option. My spouse checked in before me and when I called to ask him about the room he said it is nice but had no fireplace. I then called the front desk on my way there and a very helpful front desk staff moved our room right away to one of the suites with a fireplace. This made me happy, although I had wished they had not made the initial mistake. When I arrived at the hotel and pulled up in front no one came over to help me with my bags or to move my car, so I pulled out my own bags and moved toward the door and finally the bell hop came and gave me a claim ticket but did not ask to help me with my things. I do have to say I expect a bit more service at this caliber hotel. When I arrived we had a fire in the fireplace and I found the room very clean, the carpet comment from a previous reviewer is on target as they did seem a bit worn. The furniture was nice and the bed very comfortable. I do wish there was a fan in the bathroom as the mirror quite fogged up after my shower. Yes, as another reviewer noted, the drain could not handle the lovely shower head as it did back up a bit. We were only there one night so I cannot speak to housekeeping but they did have nice robes, towels and toiletries. The next morning on my way to the Cafe for breakfast I dropped my valet tag with someone from the front desk. I told him I was grabbing a bite to eat and would be done in less than 30 mins. He told me my car would be out front waiting for me. This was busy but not overly hectic Friday morning, so when I got outside and found out that there was no car and no knowledge of getting my request 30 mins earlier, I was not impressed with the staff's ability to follow-through. I ended having to wait another 10 mins to get my car and when the valet showed up with it he was very apologetic but also did not offer to help with my bags, he only did so after I asked if he could grab them off the luggage carrier. Overall, I think lovely accommodations with sometimes spotty service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: loversfromanisland
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an overwhelming antique feeling about it -- like you might have been transported back 100 years. The furniture, fixtures, carpets, curtains -- everything was "out of date" but in a way that appears intentional. This could be charming I suppose, but also the room was drafty and it was difficult to stay warm. The thermostat also was an "antique" and it was hard to tell if it was working. Our room was very quiet but didn't have a view. The bed was very comfortable. I could see how many people would enjoy this hotel with it's old style, but I don't think I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but lacking in key areas”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: In a fantastic location (near a number of other great hotels like the Lenox, Four Seasons, and Ritz Carlton), the Taj has tough competition. The property has beautiful touches abound (chandeliers in the hallways, antique door fixtures in the main lobby, etc.) and is simply charming. However I experienced a few things that were deal breakers for me: 1. The room (park view) was *extremely* loud. The street is busy and loud and I woke up about 5 times during the night as a result. 2. The service has mixed, but crucially flawed in dealing with complaints. I called down for my car, was told it would be up in 10-15 minutes, and waited 40 minutes (counted it on my clock). As a result, I was late to the meeting I flew out to Boston for. The valet management and hotel management was extremely unapologetic and quite frankly judgmental. Never apologized once, never offered to comp the valet. My company paid for the trip, but I don't care. I have worked in 4 diamond resorts and customer service is key. Really poor. 3. The food is really mixed. I love their breakfast, but their desserts in the bar with absolute garbage. I love desserts, my bar is really low, and I couldn't stomach either their Opera Cake or Boston Creme Pie. Their wine list was also blatantly wrong (Oh we forgot to update it... it's not an 07 napa cab, its an 08. BIG DIFFERENCE if you know wine. When asked how long the menu had been un-updated, the bartender told me about half a year). Nice guys! So fantastic location, but potentially extremely noisy and clearly not focused on delivering magical customer experiences (which is what hospitality is all about). Next time - Lenox, 4 Seasons, or Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was fantastic, but the rooms need improvement”
Reviews.Author: nancy l
Reviews.Content: On our last visit to Boston we stayed at the Taj Hotel and we were very happy with the location and the food. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. The only negative comment that I would have is that the rooms/carpet are a little old and need to be refreshed. I was extremely impressed with the service from the front desk, bell-staff and also in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: alekseyNewYork
Reviews.Content: For all the price of over $400 per night the towel in my room was so worn out that it literally was shredded to pieces. Door hinges in the bathroom were rusted throughout. All this means that the hotel is gradually falling apart. Also the hotel does not provide free WiFi. It took over 30 minutes to get my car from the parking garage. Location of the hotel is great and so is the staff. Unfortunately these little setbacks ruined my overall impression of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: 159Purple_Dot
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely and the location was perfect. We would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, issues with check in”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller74
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my mother booked a twin room, arrived early but was told room was ready but was only a king bed so we then had to wait until a twin room was ready so went for a walk and was told we would get a phone call when ready, our bags were stored for us. A couple of hours later (at normal check in time) after no phone call went back to the Hotel and was given a room (not sure if they were ever going to call). Our bags were nowhere to be seen waited for an hour or so then tried to call no answer so went down to the front desk to retrieve our bags they were very apologetic but not the level of service you would expect. The room I think was a premium park room and was very large and well appointed. The bathroom was very large (unlike some other comments there must be vast differences in room sizes and conditions). Was clean and bed very comfy. The turn down service was a nice touch. No free wi fi. Free papers each morning. The conceirge very helpful. Didn't try the Bar or Cafe & the room service breakfast prices were a bit steep so didn't try that. Had a quick peek at the exercise room not too bad. Location is the best thing about the Taj right on Newbury St across the road from Boston Public Garden & close to many lovely restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is amazing but property needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: 499Traveller
Reviews.Content: My travels to Boston are always extremely hectic and busy, having spent some time in cambridge as student, the Ritz was always my place of choice. After staying at what is known as the Taj, the hotel has kept the Grand Dame intact. while the hotel seems to be needing some investment as it does look "old" in some areas and certainly no longer comparable to the Mandarin and the Four Seasons the staff is second to none. Yes the bathrooms are small, the technology antiquated and the business center of a Comfort inn standard, the service is always impeccable. Abraham, Lindsay, James at the Concierge, Jason at the Cafe and Bruce at the bar are true ambassadors of what service should be!!! Mahmet, the Turkish gentleman at the ambassador floor was always interacting with us and offered to help for anything and everything. The cafe was extremely full over the week end but it was wroth the while, the food was great and the mimosas amazing. Wesley was superb!!! I would come back to the Taj but they need to renovate soon. Thank you for a wonderful stay and i will be back very soon

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWIFTYS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night at the end of our holiday, we had a Premium Park View room. I wouldn't book a 'Premium' room again, they only go up to the 7th floor, so the views aren't brilliant. The room was comfortable, if a little old fashioned, there was only one chair etc. The bathroom, again, not great, a cheap shower curtain, with marks on it, there were stains inside the toilet bowl, there was a stain on our bed linen also. We did complain at check out but no discount given. The location was good, but out of the 3 hotels we have stayed in, here in boston, the Ritz Carlton, is by far the best so far..... This is not up to Taj standards, if you have ever stayed in some of their other hotels. No free Wi-fi in public areas either.

Reviews.Title: “wedding luncheon”
Reviews.Author: bigbay56
Reviews.Content: Everything was delayed and many of us had to depart early for plane flights. Food was mediocre and my daughter's vegetarian risotto was probably a day old with 2000 mg. sodium. She survived on flan and gratin from rest of the table. We should have gone to Northend or Chinatown for a delicious $30 lunch. By the way, do not trust everything tripadvisor advertises. Thank God I can afford my mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelChester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in mid September. We arrived after a 12 hour journey from England at 3pm. We were very disappointed to be told our room wasn't ready but they offered to store our bags and call us when it was. We were told that they were "preparing the room now." We went for a walk around Boston Common and returned at 4pm (having had no phone call) on the presumption that the room must surely be ready. We were told that our room still wasn't ready (apparently the manager was checking it)! We were not offered any refreshments or anywhere to sit whilst we waited. We made our way into the bar and, presuming that it would be a matter of minutes before we could get into our room and have a long awaited shower, we didn't bother to order drinks. 20 minutes later we were still sat there. By this point I was increasingly frustrated and returned to the reception desk to vent. Having made my opinion perfectly clear, they deigned to "switch our room" and we were given the room key. Bizarrely we were just handed the room keys with a card folder with the room number on - no explanation as to where our room was located or which direction to go. Once we had located our room we waited for our bags. After 5 minutes we had a telephone call from the bellboy asking how many bags we had - not reassuring! He eventually arrived about 20 minutes after we entered our room. This may all seem trivial but it created such a bad impression on our arrival and was so disappointing on the first day of our holiday. It really spoilt the hotel for me. The lobby is impressive, as are the hotel corridors. Our room was ok. The decor is quite dated but looks high quality. The bathroom had a shower over the bath, which was powerful, and Molton Brown toiletries. Our room overlooked Newbury Street - nice view and no problems with noise. There was a nightly turndown service with bottled water, small chocolates, slippers and weather forecasts provided. We visited the gym once, there were 4 treadmills, a couple of bike machines, some weight machines and a cross trainer. It was quite warm in there and relatively busy at 7am. There was a small fridge with bottled water and some fruit available. The location is great - right next to Boston Common. We managed to walk to most places we wanted to visit and there were plenty of restaurants close by. We would particularly recommend Epaluche as a nice restaurant to visit. The concierge was friendly and knowledgeable and made dinner reservations for us on a couple of occasions ( we had chosen restaurants ourselves). Overall the hotel itself is alright. We paid about Â£200 per night, which seemed reasonable value given the superb location. But the first impression of not being able to check in (and being fed a load of rubbish about the room being made up "as we speak") really spoilt it for me. I simply do not understand why they could not give us a room that was ready, or ensure that all the rooms were ready by check in time. Not good enough, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: nelsonjj
Reviews.Content: The Taj Boston reminds me of staying with your 90-year old great aunt, who use to be a very fashionable lady 30 years ago, but hasn't updated anything since then. Most hotels were sold out for my trip to Boston, so I reluctantly ended up here at a rate of $450/night. The hotel has so much potential if it's owner was actually willing to invest a little money in her, but sadly, this place is old and tired. Location: Excellent. Probably the best of any hotel in Boston. Rooms: Terrible. Nothing updated in years (I doubt Taj has spent a dime on this property since they bought it from Ritz several years ago). Wallpaper is fraying, marble vanities in bathroom are cracked, plenty of noise from the streets coming through the old window, an ancient thermostat on the wall that's older than me, etc, etc, etc. I found the bed particularly amusing: it's the highest bed I've ever seen. I'm 5'9", so not exactly short, but I felt like I had to jump to get on this bed. I can only imagine the difficulty had by all the little old ladies who stay here (as evidenced by crowds in the lobby). Service: Not very good. I had difficulty with connecting to wifi, and nobody in the hotel had any clue what to do or with whom I should speak. I called the front desk for a wake-up call, but nobody answered, so I had to go to the front desk to get it. I went out with friends at night and didn't return to the hotel until about 2am - the front door was locked, and nobody answered the after-hours door bell, which I wrang for about 10 min. Finally, a janitor saw me and let me in. My wake-up call came 10 min early (not a big deal, but seriously?!!). On check out, I asked that my receipt be emailed to me (which virtually every hotel I stay at has no difficulty doing). The clerk took my email address and said he'd email it to me, but didn't get it until after I called the hotel several days later.

Reviews.Title: “could be nice years ago”
Reviews.Author: turysta78
Reviews.Content: I spent three days in Taj Boston hotel this September. The hotel was probably nice many years ago, as the remainings of the greatness are still visible. Now it seems that only the prices are those from the old days when the hotel was the first class place, and not worth it anymore. Overall - disappointment. My room was not only old and tired, but simply dirty. The carpet with stains and visibly dark in the paths walked by the guests. The front desk staff incompetent, at least in my case - I requested the invoice when I paid for my stay upon the checkout, and they gave me one with the name of the entinty which booked my stay there. I told them I need the invoice with the name of my firm, as we were the payers, they said their system does not allow changing this. It took me five minutes to persuade the front desk lady to talk to her manager, and eventually they agreed to put the name of my firm in the invoice, but only next to the name of the booking entity..... Generally - one can pay a lot for the old tradition, but only if it is maintained with adequate care. This hotel is not.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Mindy10in
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to try the Taj and recently had the opportunity. It was nice as expected. The room was great, the service excellent. Our neighbours were really noisy, and I am not sure if they were really loud or the walls were thin. When I finally complained at 3:30 am it was taken care of right away. The valet service was excellent. I had a few issues with our bill and it was taken care of promptly and efficiently. I would recomment it. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: peewee007
Reviews.Content: Everything is clean, staff is friendly and helpful, and the location is pretty central. We had a view of the park. The rooms was small and nice, without being special. The decor had a grandmotherly appeal, it reminded us of a four seasons on tighter budget (like the prices suggest). It's a fine mid-upper-mid level hotel. The services was where it got kind of iffy; room service kept telling us it that our breakfast would arrive in "another 20 minutes" for over an hour and a half, until it was too late and we were almost late for our lunch date. When we asked for our car it took almost 40 minutes for it to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: czerendipity
Reviews.Content: Overpriced by far. This wouldn't be a bad hotel if the rooms were less expensive...say $200 a night. The rooms were boxy and unoriginal, mediocre. I felt like we were staying in a slightly nicer Holiday Inn. Service was very average, not great. The lobby was beautiful. The service in the bar was wonderful. We didn't get a chance to use the restaurant or cafe so I cannot comment on them. I would highly recomend The Eliot instead. Its close to the same area, above and beyond wonderful service, and very beautiful rooms and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “great location for a visit of Boston”
Reviews.Author: lukefr965
Reviews.Content: The Taj Hotel is very well located in Boston for a visit of the city. It is in a nice area, facing the city park, which is relatively quiet, and obviously quieter than other hotels downtown. This hotel, the previous Ritz-Carlton, has large rooms, nicely furnished. Lots of closets, complimentary shoe shine, friendly staff. However, I regret that there is no place in the hotel to just sit and have a cup of coffee or tea as there is only the restaurant or the bar (the latter only opened early evening). Restaurant is a bit expensive. The 30$ entree+ main or main+dessert is of good quality, but limited quantity (and I am not even American!). However, location is perfect, central, pleasant, and a few meters from the metro station, and trendy Newbury area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Luxurious with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: saba888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night of our daughter's wedding. The reception was held in the main ballroom. The room was beautiful and well-appointed, but had a very small bathroom. The robes were luxurious, but we totally missed the slippers which I later discovered that we would have been able to keep. It was a short night's stay since we just got dressed and didn't return to the room until 1 AM. The bed was comfortable, and the coffee in the lobby was delicious. The location can't be beat to stay at the beginning of Newbury St. across from the Boston Public Garden!

Reviews.Title: “great location, little old school but nice”
Reviews.Author: trippyNYC
Reviews.Content: i feel the hotel had more cache as a ritz, right at the head of newbury but besides the name, the interior feels elegantly old school. the rooms aren't brand new but are a nice size except for the bathroom. i don't think i've ever been in a smaller bathroom, where the door bumps into the toilet without opening all the way. nice views of park, room service food is pretty good, staff in general are friendly and professional. one night our room was not made up yet at 6:30p so maybe they forgot our room on the rounds. glass doorknobs, turn-locks on the doors--things you don't see at the newer hotels anymore. walls are thin or our neighbors were esp loud people. wi-fi is paid per computer (not per room). easy to walk to newbury, copley, charles st, chinatown. gym is basic gym hotel, 24hr key access.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but goodie”
Reviews.Author: jma5000
Reviews.Content: First time stay at a Taj hotel and was pleased with the level of service. The rooms aren't brand new (last refresh was perhaps 2002 I believe) but they are decorated in a traditional taste and are clean and fully serviceable. I stayed in a junior suite with my wife and 14 month old daughter. The room was perfect for us as it allows our daughter to sleep in a crib in the living room while we can relax in the bedroom (separated by a door) without worrying about waking her up or having difficulty putting her to sleep. We ate breakfast in the cafe both mornings - great food, though reasonably pricey (as is the case at this level of property) though we had a food & beverage credit which made the meals almost free. Overall service level throughout was great, quick with luggage and other basic requests. Our daughter evidently charmed the staff in the cafe at breakfast as she was waited on by several staff members, who provided her with a complimentary plate of blueberries and continually cleaned up the floor of the mess a toddler is wont to make. Overall, the price of the room was reasonable for a suite and the thrown in extras when booking through an agent improved the value equation somewhat. While there are definitely cheaper alternatives in Boston, for the level of service and if you need the extra room that a suite provides, it would be difficult to find a more inexpensive property that provided the same level of quality. Definitely plan on staying again when I visit family in the area unless the prices were much higher than what I paid to stay over Labor Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice room but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Flyboy2211
Reviews.Content: Taj has a great location within walking distance to lots of attractions room was nice but didn't offer anything to stand out from other hotels in this price point

Reviews.Title: “Customer Delight”
Reviews.Author: mmld
Reviews.Content: We booked the room as part of a vacation package with the airline. Unfortunately when we arrived they had us in a room with a King Bed not two doubles which we requested. they had none available so they upgraded us to a suite with a roll away. Arriving at the hotel after midnight, from a plane with out a meal, the bellman offered an alternative to room service, two open restaurants and walked with us a block away to get us there! The food was great and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be the Ritz; should also "used to be" the Taj”
Reviews.Author: FreqTraveler35
Reviews.Content: A great location with a pleasant and helpful staff; but it's frankly way short of Taj standards, including retaining much of the old Ritz furniture. A spacious closet, yet tiny bathroom in our king bed room. Nice touches in the room, but plaster bulging from a "water event" in the ceiling doesn't help the feeling that the whole place is getting just a little seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Outclassed by other options”
Reviews.Author: Porpex
Reviews.Content: The Taj clearly wants to compete with properties like the Four Seasons or the Mandarin Oriental, but it has a monstrously long way to go to compete with those giants. It's only real asset is location, on a posh corner near the Boston Common. The room decor is more dowdy grandma than chic, and we even noticed some unappealing stains on the carpet. The bathroom was cramped and small, and the inside of the closet looked like it hadn't been modernized in years. When we initially pulled up to the hotel, rather than being greeted by a welcoming valet, we would curtly told we had to enter via a different route. Not a gracious welcome for a hotel aspiring to four or more stars. We ordered room service (coffee and two muffins; a meal that didn't even require turning on a stove), and it was an hour wait; by the time it arrived, we had to leave it behind on the tiny room desk because we had a plane to catch. The housekeeping staff was chatty and loud in the morning; we could hear them outside our door at a regrettably early hour. At almost $500 for a single night's stay in an undistinguished room, this place is egregiously overpriced. At those rates, it should offer something at least distinctive and special. Instead, it felt like a shell of the old Ritz Carlton that time and TLC had long since left in the dust....

Reviews.Title: “Just right for us!”
Reviews.Author: Tuck033
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Taj Boston on the way to a bicycle trip in Maine. We don't typically use a lot of the peripheral servces (spas, restaurant, etc.), so our judgments are limited to the basic hotel experience. First of all, for our purpose, the location couldn't have been better....Boston Common across the street, a walk to the Freedom Trail, a longer, but manageable walk to the Boston Duck Tour start at the Prudential Plaza, and a Starbucks two blocks away. (That last one is probably true for every hotel!) Check-in and check-out were quick and friendly. Room size and arrangement were very good. Bathroom was on the smaller side, but also well-arranged, so there was enough room for all our bath and shaving products. I appreciated that the whole bath was marble or granite, so it seemed pretty new, but could just be wearing well. It felt like we were staying at a pretty high-end hotel, but for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Was not upto 'Taj standards'”
Reviews.Author: NCou
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband when he stayed here for a week-long company conference. The best thing about this hotel is its location, there is no denying it. Apart from that, it just felt like any other place you might stay in...The rooms are nicely done but nothing unforgettable and the service was average. At my husband's end, everything was very well organized for their conference but I was not very impressed. I was really looking forward to this stay as we've been to other Taj hotels and have always have had a great experience. When the check-out staff asked us how our stay had been, I told them about each of my experiences : - piece of bacon in my scrambled eggs that I brought to the attention of my server. Of course he was very apologetic when I told him I did not eat pork but that was it! - the description of the food on their menu is not always right and the maitre d' agreed. - our laundry was folded as requested but was such a shabby job that I had to have the shirts done again by my regular cleaner. I did call the laundry staff to tell them that the folding was unacceptable but since we were checking out the next day there was no time for them to re-do it, and we were charged as usual. None of the above are major or critical issues but given that all of these occurred at a Taj hotel during one stay, I could not hide my disappointment to the check-out staff. They promised that someone would get in touch with me soon but that has not happened.

Reviews.Title: “Ho hum”
Reviews.Author: thorgan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a business trip and don't see why this would get more then 3, possibly 4 stars. The location is good, but the room - or at least the one I had - was what you'd expect for the money we paid. It is well appointed, clean, but not very big with a view of a street. Perhaps the ones overlooking the Gardens would be better, or at least have a better view. I was put off by the dreaded "housekeeping!" knock at the door at 8:30 while I was getting ready. Struck me as too early, and too noisy, for that - at least in a better hotel. Bottom line: it was a hotel room. Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kikoBruxelles
Reviews.Content: Great location! Spacious and comfortable rooms. Be sure to book one with a city or park view. Excellent service, friendly and efficient staff. One of the best hotels I've stayed at. One not unimportant detail:wifi is not free....most hotels in Europe, even 2 or 3 stars ones, offer free wifi to their clients. Seen the category of the hotel, free wifi would add to to the high quality services offered by this great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel??? Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: REALGrunge
Reviews.Content: The Taj Hotel Boston is a definitely not a level five star hotel and I am at a loss as to why it is viewed as such. The hotel may be an old hotel, but it is far from elegant. While the hotel lobby is tastefully and elegantly designed, the hallways are plain and ordinary. The room was small and the furniture was unremarkable, although the bed was comfortable. There is no free internet service (they charge $10.95/day) unless you visit their Business Center (where they charge you 10 cents a page for printing.) The worst part about The Taj, however, is their atrocious customer service: I made reservations two weeks ahead of time and spoke to a front desk person, requesting a refrigerator, a rollaway bed and a coffee maker for my room. He told me it wouldnâ€™t be a problem and he would make a note of it on my reservation. When I checked in Sunday, August 1st, the front desk person first argued with me about directly billing the company I work for and then said she knew nothing about a refrigerator, a rollaway bed and a coffee maker for my room, but said she would have them sent up right away. I also requested a NY Times be delivered to my room each morning, which, I was told, also wouldnâ€™t be a problem. The refrigerator and rollaway arrived right away, but I was given some story about only a limited number of coffee makers were allowed in the hotel because of the outlets. The a/c didnâ€™t work properly and I asked the hotel to send somebody up to fix it, which they eventually did. I also asked for a couple of extra pillows, towels and a child size robe (which is advertised on their website.) I had to ask for the pillows and towels twice, the coffee maker three times and the NY Times nine times even though they kept saying it wouldnâ€™t be a problem and they would make a note of it on my reservation. (they kept delivering The Wall Street Journal instead.) The child size robe never arrived. The a/c eventually malfunctioned again and gave the room a damp musty odor which was never fully removed by the time I checked out on August 12th (the third floor, where their Business Center is hidden, also has a damp musty odor.) When I finally complained to the Asst. GM, the NY Times arrived twice and then stopped coming and the coffee maker arrived with two packets of coffee (enough for two cups of coffee; when I asked for some creamer for the coffee, it was brought to my room and sullenly shoved at me.) Housekeeping removed the extra towels and never returned them, even though I again asked for extra towels. Housekeeping also complained about my wife and daughter sleeping late, saying they were making it difficult to make up the room. Boston is a terrific city which I have really fallen in love with. Everyone should go there. Just donâ€™t stay at the The Taj Hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! Not usually into old school but the service was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: minnesnowtachris
Reviews.Content: I've read the bad reviews on here- they're the same people who give the Hampton five star ratings because their lard laden bodies just love that free breakfast or the folks who live everything all new and furnished by IKEA. This hotel is a hotel . Not a concept. The location is amazing. The rooms have a very simple comfort to them. The decor is old school- some will say dated but it's actually classic and fits in well with Boston- you know, one of the oldest cities in the US. Gym users: small gym, you may want to buy a day pass from Boston Sports Club down the street. Ask the front desk for details. Runner- Boston Common is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “one night was not enough”
Reviews.Author: brooklyntrish
Reviews.Content: my friend blocked rooms here for her wedding as this was the location of the reception, so we didn't pay the list price for our room. my boyfriend and i arrived at 11am, well before the check-in time, but were welcome to check in that early. AWESOME!!! the hotel is located on the corner of newbury street. there are so many nice shops there but you'll have to walk a block over for any food. parish was a nice spot with a good amount of outdoor seating, and friendly bartenders inside. cocktail hour was served up on the top floor with great views over boston commons on a beautiful day. the reception was on the 2nd floor of the hotel; the room was very well decorated with a dance floor sized good enough for the room size. our room itself was nice. not much of a view, but we just had a deluxe room. king size bed, two bathrobes, and a bath menu - that was a first!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the investment ...”
Reviews.Author: SwissFrenchBrit
Reviews.Content: Great location, facing the parks in the centre of town. Pleasant rooms with everything you would expect, though some face into the less than beautiful inside of the building. Excellent if pricy breakfast in the CafÃ©, with some of the best service IÂ´ve encountered in Boston. IÂ´d recommend staying here for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, excellent stay and we would love to return”
Reviews.Author: BhupiJain
Reviews.Content: Taj Boston is perhaps the best located hotel overlooking the Boston public park and right next to Bolyston street. It is a very well maintained 5 star property. We recently spent 5 days here with our two teenage kids and loved our stay. Frankly, we were pleasantly surprised given a few negative ratings and reviews from other travelers. Being Indian, we are familiar with the very high standards of the 'Taj' hospitality and were not let down this time too. The staff was initially aloof yet courteous. As we became more familiar faces, their attitudes thawed! The pillows and mattresses were very comfortable. Negatives.....lack of free wi fi in this day and age and very poor cell phone signal in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An extra level of pampering on the Taj Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: MinisterOfCulture
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Taj Boston again this past July 2011, for a week, and experienced for the first time the pleasures of the Taj Boston Club floors, having a room overlooking Boston's Public Gardens and Commons from the 14th floor, and having access to the Club Lounge on the 15th floor. The views are unsurpassed for a Boston hotel, and the service was excellent - Mehmet Kugu and his staff in the Club Lounge saw to the every need of myself and my guest, and the lounge was a luxurious and pretty venue in which to consume a Continental breakfast, a light lunch, tea, or a snack.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place but a bit "old style"”
Reviews.Author: deburlin
Reviews.Content: Perfect service, good rooms, ... but a bit old style.

Reviews.Title: “Always great!”
Reviews.Author: zaydah
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Taj Boston. This hotel has an amazing location, the rooms are comfortable, filled with the details of a 5 star hotel. We enjoyed breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning, and though a little slow, the food was very good. We especially enjoyed the hotel bar which is elegant and has excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - surprised at so many negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Librabirthday
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just stayed here for 4 nights and had a fabulous stay. Maybe we were lucky with our rooms - but they were clean and spotless. Ok - the bathroom was a little small, but how much time do you spend in there? We had rooms overlooking the Park and I couldn't fault them at all. The beds and pillows were sumptuous and so comfortable. The concierge team were fantastic - so helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment, but there are some excellent restaurants around, but go early if you want to sit on the patios. The exercise room was very good - and equipment all in good order. There were headsets to use, fruit and water, towels and papers - very good. I would not hesitate to go back - we were all very much at home here. I just can't see what all the negative comments are all about - and I am a seasoned traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room did not live up to expectations ....”
Reviews.Author: LGCLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically located in Boston. It is directly opposite the common, at the top end of Newbury Street (great for shopping etc). I stayed here with my eldest daughter, and most of the tourist attractions and shopping were within walking distance. However, although the lobby of the hotel appears smart, the rooms was disappointing and underwhelming. The bathroom small and tired, although clean and functional, and the bedroom very mediocre - clean, but tired furniture, tired upholstery etc. In fact, the entire hotel needs updating. I stayed at the Taj (Pierre) in New York 18 months ago, and that was a very different experience, as the entire hotel has been totally renovated and the rooms are beautifully refurbished. The Taj do get one thing right in both cases as both hotels are directly on the park. This hotel could be spectacular, but needs some money spending on it to up it's game. There is so much wasted space - the 17th Floor is only open for brunch on a Sunday and has the most spectacular views over Boston, but this floor is not open for the rest of the week. The First floor also has some spectacular rooms, again with incredible views, that are empty of people. Presumably they are used for functions. I would return, purely because the location is fantastic. Breakfast is overpriced, but Starbucks is just around the corner, and if you want something more substantial I would recommend Paramount, 44 Charles Street - undeniably the best breakfast in town.

Reviews.Title: “WELL... YOU ARE NOT AT THE RITZ ANYMORE”
Reviews.Author: discoverluxury
Reviews.Content: TAJ Boston is a certainly not at the level of a 5 star hotel and I am surprised it is viewed as LEADING hotels of the world . The rooms are dated and as I read from other reviews the most telling sign is how DIRTY the carpeting is . Do yourself a favor and stay at the Four Seasons .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel not so good service!”
Reviews.Author: astridetlulu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely well located and rooms are lovely. The big problem is the service! Arrived at 2.30 in afternoon room was not ready. They proposed to keep bags and give us a call when room will be ready. Two hours later still no news! Got room finally at 5.30 but was not fully prepared. A lot of people in same situation. Therefore the number of bags to store were massive. It took then 20 mins to found them.... Then at check out the bill was wrong. They took the print back but could not print a new one as printer was broken... They proposed to send bill by mail. 3 days later and we are still waiting to receive it. We have no proof of how much they charged us...... Terrible. Would not recommend at all.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great service, well located”
Reviews.Author: spicelore
Reviews.Content: Like all Taj hotels this ones a winner. In the busy, trendy yet historic Backbay neighborhood this heritage, renovated Taj property has huge rooms, high ceilings, big windows, old world charm and many modern amenities. Its really close to Filenes basement and many other great shops in the area. Good breakfast and welcoming staff make this a lovely place to stay. Very close to the Arlington subway stop on the green line- you can change to other lines at Park. Boston Commons is really close by and there are some terrific bars and restaurants in the area- try Lespalier if you want to splurge, Sorellina, Tapeo and Parish Cafe for a good breakfast or sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations, we would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mom22girlz
Reviews.Content: Nice large rooms with closets, chests, and sizeable bathrooms. Very quiet. Good breakfast can be had in the restaurant on site, but quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but feeling a little tired”
Reviews.Author: pensfan58
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a quick business trip and the Taj was perfect for coming into Back Bay Station on Amtrak, and two meetings, one on Newbury and one at the Pru Center. The staff was friendly and I enjoyed a nice glass of wine and chat at the bar with the bartender and a guest. However, the room needed to be spruced up a bit. The curtains has some marks on them (dirt, grease), the rug looked like it could be replaced soon and there was a few spots on the baseboard where the paint has peeled away. Nothing that felt dirty or unpleasant but just needing a little TLC. I'd stay again as the view over the Commons and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in customer service!”
Reviews.Author: HammondFour
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a two week trip to the States. We spent 4 days at the Taj on the recommendation of a friend and we were not disappointed. This hotel prides itself on first class customer service and even by American standards it was exceptional. The rooms are spacious and very nicely decorated. The restaurant served excellent food and the staff were delightful. We enjoyed a drink in the bar most evenings and again found the staff attentive and friendly. The same could be said for the reception desk, doormen and maid service. But the real jewel in their crown is their concierge desk - NOTHING was too much trouble. Every restaurant they recommended was spot on as was the recommended unofficial tour of Harvard. Thank you to all at the Taj for making our first trip to Boston so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid it like a plague. Dated and smelly. MacDonalds have better staffs.”
Reviews.Author: kowkowzeiss
Reviews.Content: Deluxe park view room. I wish I could give zero star. Never again. Hotel room etc etc is important, but when the staffs are completely incompetent, even the best room is the world is a waste. And it's by far at most a motel level room. Don't touch the carpet for one thing. Arrived 05:45. After another overnight flight. Requested early check in one week ago. Apparently absolutely fully booked. Fair enough. Since 05:45 at least 50 people/room checked out. Not much fun sitting/slouching in the lobby waiting, thought i'd contribute to the well being of other tired travellers. My room has been vacated and available since 08:00, they told me. Three hours later, 5 phone calls, reassurance that the house keeping staffs will attend to it pronto; room still not ready. Are they just scratching their rear in other rooms or is this the efficiency in this hotel? Really, if i wanted an iron or similar in the room it'll be brought up just like that, NOT THIS JOKE. This hotel is just not good enough for business travellers. No shower at the gym. Can't go for a shower. No spa, can't freshen up after a long flight. Staffs in general do their best to help their customers. I didn't think it's rocket science but at Taj they are pure amateurs. Don't write some quasi regret reply Taj. You are blight on the hotel community and other travellers have already attested to it. Fellows. PLEASE AVOID THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, unorganized staff”
Reviews.Author: MTHSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We had booked the park suite with a connecting room for our kids for 4 nights. Unlike other reviewers, we found the room accommodation to be good. Yes, a bit dated decoration but overall good (not so different from the Four Season next door but not as modern as Mandarin up the street--two comparative hotel chains we usually stay with). Also good-sized rooms for the price. The problem we had with Taj Boston was more about the staff, which reflects poorly on the management of the place. They seemed flippant and unorganized. The airline delivered a late piece of luggage, but the staff said no luggage had been delivered. Only when we chased down the airline and confronted the hotel about this did the luggage appear. One morning a staff member came to the door for a wakeup call which we had not ordered. Another time the bell man came to pick up some luggage, and then another called 5 minutes later to say they would soon pick it up. When we asked a staff member whether the hotel had a pool, he answered, yes "your tub in your room." Funny, but not the professional response you expect at a 5-star hotel. It seems to me that all of this could be improved if the manager of the hotel just trained and organized the staff better.

Reviews.Title: “" You Don't get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: sonny7861
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very conveinent location, down town Boston. Across is a beautiful park with a great downtown of Boston shopping and food.3 Times room service just walk in,twice without knocking. check velet parking pricing as they dont tell you when you book the room which can add to be very expensive if you living there for more then two days. over all service is nice but very slow. "SRK"

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Theonlyduck
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Taj Boston just past noon. When I went to check in, the clerk behind the desk informed me that my room was not ready as the previous guest had just checked out.
