I inquired if it were possible to put me into another room as I had a business meeting at 3pm and would need to change into proper attire and freshen up after my flight. The clerk informed he "had nothing at my rate" (in a tone I found quite condescending, especially since "my rate" was the result of my company booking myself and 20 other clients and coworkers into the hotel for this paticular meeting). In 20 years of business travel I have never had a problem checking into a hotel a few hours early. The clerk said he would put my room as priority for cleaning but it would still take sometime. I left my bag and decided to go have lunch and take a stroll. Before leaving I again reminded the clerk I had a 3 pm meeting and would appreciate it if the room could be ready. I arrived back at the Taj about 2 hours later, there was now a new clerk at the desk. This clerk informed me that my room was not ready as the previous guests had just checked out. I mentioned that I had heard the same thing from the previous clerk 2 hours earlier. Again there was nothing they could do and they could not find me another room. When I inquired about a place to quickly change and freshen up, I was shown the way to the public bathrooms outside of the conference rooms. That evening when I returned my room was ready to check in however my bag was now locked in the bell hop's room and apparently only the bell hop could get it out. I needed my bag immediately as I now had to change for dinner and knowing just checking in took several hours and several attempts I was not prepared to wait until someone could bring it to my room. So I wait almost a half hour for the bell hop to come back and unlock the room so I could have my bag. When I finally made it to my room I was greeted by a stained carpet and tired looking furniture. The room was not uncomfortable or unclean (other than the carpert), it just did not live up to my expectations of a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and will be back”
Reviews.Author: PMHM711
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great service, excellent location, good food, 15 mins from airport, great value and if you get a park view it's fantastic. Definitely recommend the Taj Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Taj was great! The service was perfect and the employees were extremely pleasant and helpful. The Bar was great for drinks and light fare. Afternoon tea was a wonderful experience. The Taj was the best hotel we have stayed at in Boston. Great location as well. The Taj is a step above most hotels in the city - and they help has been with this facility even before when it was The Ritz location. They recognize you almost immediately, not necessarily by name, but "welcome you back"...every time I arrive there. You would be hard pressed to find a better location to Newbury Street, The Commons, Theatre, Restaurants - all that my "home" city has to offer! All in all having been in some of the top hotels in the world I think the TAJ is one of the best and definaly the only one I will stay at when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Taj is without doubt the best place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: MarionMontgomery
Reviews.Content: As everybody confirms The Taj is in a perfect central Boston location with one elevation looking out towards the common. Getting there from Logan is easy and on arrival we were met by 3 friendly staff that assisted in getting our luggage off our transport. On checking in the staff couldnâ€™t have been more helpful and polite and when we checked out 8 days later we were given our room at no extra cost until 5pm...how thoughtful and civilised! The concierge was most helpful and knowledgeable on more than one occasion- they will also help with getting on-line flight boarding tickets. Our room on the 10th floor was more typically European size but was perfectly laid out, spotlessly clean and extremely well maintained. We had all we required, personally I donâ€™t like kettles ,cups and cartons of milk and sachets of sugar etc in the room, it reminds me too much of cheap motels so their absence was a positive...if anyone is that desperate for a fix of tea or coffee why can't they order from room service or even wander to a local Starbucks ? Wi-Fi reception was excellent and was about $10 per day which is slightly annoying but is all too typical and if you need it for business it is somewhat of an irrelevancy......and if you just want it for "pleasure" and are desperate to visit the ether then why not just tootle down to the coffee shop 100yds away and spend your days glued to a screen for free? The room fridge was well stocked and for this standard of hotel reasonably priced. Room service, maid and evening turn down was of the highest standard - 10 out of 10! Breakfast was a real pleasure however the small restaurant room filled quickly at peak times, many of the clientele were locals not guests. I can really recommend the eggs Benedict â€“ superb. The restaurant staff are polite,busy and attentive, the seating ultra comfortable and all in all it is a great experience, the perfect way to start your day. In hot weather the air conditioning in both rooms and public areas was always at a perfect level. The bar is fabulously sumptuous â€“ decor and ambiance, it has everything spot on perfect! The drinks are served in the "old way" thankfully and by staff that has been doing the job for many years and their calm professionalism is clear for all to see...the cocktails â€“ try a Newbury â€“ are delicious. We ate dinner informally in the bar twice â€“ simple fare at sensible prices - Kobe burger, shrimps Ceasar,clam chowder- all excellently presented and high quality. This is an old school 5 star hotel and therefore the rates it charges reflect this so when you book there appreciate this ......so to those who complain of high cost for this and that I ask â€œwhat did you expect?â€� You pay for what you get and at the Taj you get a lot. If you are used to this standard of hotel the rates are certainly not exorbitant, in fact they are significantly less than an equivalent hotel in London or Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great food...”
Reviews.Author: satyajitdattaroy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully located and although the rooms a wee bit small, they were great to stay. The service was top class and the banquet arrangements were perfect. For the tourist you are at the cultural & social centre of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: Homeboy_hols
Reviews.Content: The Taj is in a nice location near the common. When we arrive at 16:00 hrs our room wasnâ€™t ready, we had to wait 15 minutes as the people before us were late leaving. However when we left we asked if we could leave at 13:00 hrs instead of 12:00, we were told we had to vacate as the room was booked. The room was large, strangely the sink to wash your hands after going to the toilet was in the room rather than in the bathroom, not very hygienic. The Wifi was about $11 per day and there were no coffee making facilities. So we went out for coffee and to use the internet. The last morning I got up to be greeted by a bill for $124 which had been pushed under the door. This was supposedly for the use of the honor bar which we had not used. When I went to reception to complain the charge was waved with hardly a comment, very strange. We didnâ€™t attempt to eat here as my bank manager would have disowned me. I donâ€™t think we will be back and I donâ€™t think the hotel we be bothered by that as they seem to have some well healed clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless Elegance and Grace”
Reviews.Author: Patroclas
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four days staying at the Taj Boston. The Taj is one of those older style hotels that hark back to a different age and I quite anticipated it would be stuffy and pretentious but no. The greeting when we arrived was both warm and friendly with some humour thrown in from the lady on the front desk. Our room on the 12th floor was huge!! And the bed was very comfortable. It was very unusual but the chairs and foot stools provided were actually usable and not there just for ornament or for throwing your dirty clothes over. This is a first chairs used for sitting in and not throwing your selves straight on the bed when returning from a day on the town. The location I would say is the best in Boston ideal for all the sites and the Taj sits well in the Georgian style surroundings of the Back Bay and Beacon Hill district. We used the hotel for breakfast and they were wonderful and so well presented with helpful restaurant manger and staff. We managed a window seat most mornings which was great watching the commuters struggling to work clutching coffees and brief cases. One minor moan and it is minor. The plug didnâ€™t work in the basin or bath and you had to leave the taps running when washing and shaving. I did point this out on day one to the front desk but nothing was done. I am sure the Taj group has signed up to a corporate social responsibility statement which includes water and I am positive they wouldnâ€™t be amused that thousands of litres of water are being thrown away in this room each year because the front desk did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure at the TAJ”
Reviews.Author: Uncorked4u
Reviews.Content: As always, our stay was a pleasure at the Taj in Boston. The building is ON the Boston Common and used to be the Ritrz, before they moved. The bathrooms are updated, the rooms are spacious and the staff is top notch. Make sure you ask for a room with a fireplace..its a unique experience!!! The hotel is great for a romantic getaway (we've done weekends there numerous times) and accommodates all business needs. The location couldn't be better...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic concierge, tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: baileydogg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Taj with our 3 year old and the staff were wonderful in making her feel at home. Coloring books and crayons are staple at breakfast. The lady concierge was very helpful in advising us on where to take her and when, got us the tickets, had them left in our room and was incredibly instrumental in making us to do the most in three days with our toddler. The location is superb being near Newbury and the Commons. The rooms and bathrooms however were very tired, we have stayed at Taj hotels in India and were quite disappointed in the lack of 'Taj' luxury in the rooms. The bathroom sinks did not drain, the plastic tub mat was dirty and the walls were chipped. A renovation and more attention to detail would help elevate the whole experience of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: moises74
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for four nights at the Taj and the location was excelent. The rooms are very nice and everything worked perfect. The attention of the concierge is also very very good. I would recommend this hotel if you plan a trip to Boston. I was a little afraid about the bad comments posted in this site and thatÂ´s why ÃŒ`m giving my opinion. Go to the Taj , you won`t regret

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot..Felt very special”
Reviews.Author: cruisechic2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for a couple days after a New England cruise. This hotel was great rooms were a little dated but the whole staff made you feel comfortable and Special. We had a room on the club level and enjoyed those benefits and the views were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations, service”
Reviews.Author: MattZup
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston for work a couple of weeks ago and stayed 3 nights at The Taj. Both my co-worker and I were upgraded to a suite upon check-in. We stayed Mon-Thurs, so this may have had something to do with it. The room was magnificent and the bed was wonderful. This was a quality stay accross the board. My suite even had a fireplace, which I didn't use, but would have been nice had it been a different time of year. The city of Boston is very enjoyable and this hotel added to it. I would like to return with my wife sometime soon, I will seriously have to consider splurging for The Taj.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LRBSEB
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely one of the finest hotels we have ever visited. The location at the Park with access to the "T", sight-seeing trollies, Beacon Street Homes and other amenities was just perfect for our vacation. The bar waiter, Carlos, from Chile, is the best. We hope when he retires he moves to San Antonio.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fireman4
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? I booked this 2 night stay through Amex's Fine Hotels & Resorts (FHR) program for myself, wife and 18-month old daughter and this stay was pure disappointment. First, the "good": the front desk staff upon check-in was friendly, the lobby was clean, the bell staff was friendly, and the views from the room were very nice (room 530 overlooks the Commons). Now, the "not so good": As part of the FHR Program, we received an "upgraded" room, however the "upgraded" room was small, only large enough for a king bed & crib (room size has been mentioned in other reviews as well). While the room is furnished, the furnishings don't have any drawers where you can actually store clothing. The tables don't have drawers and there is an armoire, but the cabinet contains a large fridge and the 3 small drawers next to the fridge contain snacks, so there is NO place to unpack any clothing. Let's talk plugs. It's 2011. How many people travel with multiple personal electronics? For this trip, both my wife and I had cell phones, I had my work BlackBerry and a laptop. So, that's 4 personal electronic devices. We found ONE usable plug. No, that's not an exaggeration. Speaking of laptops, Internet is billed at $10.75 a day which is a COMPLETE money-grab and rip-off. You can stay at the Marriott or Holiday Inn for half the price and get free internet. For the price the Taj charges a night, they can throw in free Internet, but since their clientele can afford their prices, perhaps they think they can just charge for access? Finally, the "complimentary continental breakfast" I received through the FHR program wasn't complimentary. You HAD to order the continental breakfast to get it "free"; otherwise, you received a $16 breakfast credit. So, my pancakes and $6 orange juice (yes, $6 orange juice) + coffee = more than $16 which means that I ended up paying some cash for breakfast each morning. Once again, nickle & dimed. In general, I felt ripped off and let down and my stay was NOT what I would have expected through a property offered in the FHR program. This property is like one of those old dowager princesses that like to live in the past and think they're still relevant, where in truth, the other nobility shun her and barely tolerate her. The property needs to wake up and come into the 21st century and stop with the ridiculous charges. I would NOT recommend this property for anyone, including business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: earthkarma
Reviews.Content: My husband ran the Boston Marathon, and we stayed at The Taj Boston for 3 nights. They told us that our room had been "ugraded" through American Express. If our room was an upgrade, I'd love to know what the other rooms were like! The bed seemed clean, which is a BIG plus, but the carpet was horrendously dirty, which was pretty horrible, since I didn't want to walk on it in bare feet, and then into a clean bed! When the cleaning woman was in some of the other rooms with the door open...I looked and the carpeting was dirty in them as well. I also had to call each day to have them deliver more towels. When we first got there, there were 2 towels. Then I called and they brought me up some really nice BIG towels. Then the next day, they put in one small towel...and I had to call them again for some of the big towels! It was really weird. Also, the way that the bathroom is set up, there wasn't any place to put items such as makeup, hairblower, etc. The people in the dining room were actually pretty darned nasty. The food was okay, but the people serving just seemed so unhappy. Don't know what the problem was. Also, if you ask them for hot water (I brought my own tea bags because I only like one kind of tea)...they will still charge you $4.50. To say something nice: It had a good location on a trendy street across from a beautiful park.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience at Taj”
Reviews.Author: Nicholsfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: I travel heavily for business. AmEx Platinum services has good Fine Hotels package so we tried Taj instead of Mandarin or Charles. Great location, pretty nice hotel. Felt nickel and dimed at each turn, starting with getting a few aspirins from the concierge ! ($3, please). Canceled return reservation and switched to Charles Hotel this week.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location, superb staff...simply one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: justwarren
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times in the past 5 years. It has only gotten better. This is a first rate hotel by any standard. The staff is perhaps, the best hotel staff you will find anywhere. Very professional, courteous, friendly and helpful. I love this hotel! This last stay, I had a slight problem, I misplaced a shoe bag in my hotel room. It was a very silly thing. It may have very well been my fault. I just couldn't find it and neither could housekeeping. Initially, they thought they might have thrown it away by mistake, they were quite apologetic. When I left, I called security at the hotel. The shoe bag, while having almost no commercial value was a very well made, old cloth felt bag passed down to me from my father. The security person treated this as if it was an heirloom diamond ring. After an exhaustive search of the room and "key records" to make sure it wasn't stolen, they found my shoe bag after they re-searched the room for the um-teenth time. This only happens at a hotel where the staff really take pride in their jobs. I travel a lot for business. By and large, I find it's not much fun. But This is one of my favorite all time hotels. You can relax here, and it's a perfect jumping off point to see and enjoy Boston. Whoever runs this place should give lessons on how to run a hotel right!

Reviews.Title: “International Old World Flavor with More Comforts than Home!”
Reviews.Author: pdhmaine
Reviews.Content: My husband is attending a conference, but we didn't call for reservations in time, so I looked around for accommodations nearby. After reading lots of reviews online, I decided the Taj would best meet our needs. In reality, our expectations have been far exceeded. A quick walk through the Public Garden takes my husband to his conference, and we feel quite fortunate to be staying at the more intimate Taj. I have Newbury Street to enjoy, and the T is a block away -- Boston is such an accessible city, and the Taj is central to everything. The staff is courteous, attending to guests' every need. Rooms are quiet and comfortable -- I want to bring the bed home with me! Breakfasts and dinners have been delicious, and offer lots of variety. Portions are just right. Don't miss afternoon tea on Saturdays & Sundays -- a rare treat! The Taj will appeal to travelers who appreciate Old World flavor, with attention to every detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruchiekaur
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about five or more times. Great location, clean rooms, nice staff, close to parking, overlooking one of the nicest parks in downtown boston (request the top floors), close to restaurants and boutiques. I would recommend this hotel for a work or leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Taj is amazing”
Reviews.Author: spudsr
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are beautiful. The service was Rich, warm and out of this world. I had the suite with a fireplace. The fireplace suite comes with a Fireplace butler and a choice of firewood. How incredible is that! The bathroom ammenities. Love Love Love them. The bed was the most comfortable and I even had a choice of what type of pillow's I wanted. The hotel sits on Arlington and Newberry Street and I had a view of the public garden. This hotel was fabulous. Dont miss this hotel while your in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel, some minor niggles”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: This is a top end city hotel. Well located and furnished, it's respectable, comfortable, and classy. So with high expectations come pickiness... but don't let the list of negatives put you off - it's a good hotel. The location is great if you need to be at that end of town, and it's a classic and well renovated building. I checked in just before midnight. There was nobody at the door, in the reception area, or at the reception desk. I had to call the house phone to find a receptionist. They came immediately and were polite and pleasant, but it was the first time I've walked into a five star hotel to an absent welcome. Ever. The room was large and comfortable. It looked over an interior courtyard, but having booked a cheap rate I had no complaint. The room was all you'd expect - good bed, long bath, good toiletries, sufficient working space. I'd have liked an ipod plug-in (there was a CD player), and bath salts for the bath would have been a nice touch. Nevertheless this was a classic five-star room. I slept well (overslept, in fact, which I hardly ever do!). Internet, which was fast and easy to connect to, was predictably expensive (and annoyingly your login works only for one device - you pay double if you want to use your smartphone, which is egregious). The workout room was clearly a converted accommodation suite. It had a good range of aerobic machines, good free weights, some resistance machines... all ok. The floor was carpeted, which always feels inappropriate in a gym (I'm sure the bacterial guest population would disagree). I had a very late breakfast in the cafe. The server was efficient, polite, and professional, maybe a lit aloof but then I was eating breakfast at lunchtime and this was Boston not northern California! The coffee upheld the most established traditions of American coffee (sorry, that was a European dig... ) but it kept coming and was fresh. The food was good as it should be at the price point and the ambience was pleasant. Checkout was excellent, with plenty of help with bags, friendly service, and help with directions; it redeemed the sad check-in nicely. As part of the Taj chain you'll see Indian specialities on the menu, and there were a few more Indian guests than you'd expect. Good to see Taj spreading its wings from its iconic Mumbai roots. I had a very comfortable and relaxing overnight stay, and would not be embarrassed to tell business associates I was staying there. But at this standard of hotel, my bar is set high, and I noticed even the minor wrinkles that really didn't detract from my happiness... they just shouldn't be there.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with the telephone charges”
Reviews.Author: MC98000
Reviews.Content: If you stay at the Taj Boston, NEVER use the room telephone for long distance, a 10 minutes call to New York cost $ 30,00. They also charge for internet. A hotel of their class should at least have free internet, it looks cheap too charge... A part from that, all its good at the TAJ.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, service excellent, if not a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: betDublin
Reviews.Content: The Taj is a fantastic hotel. It used to be the Ritz& they havent changed the decor much, which is a little outdated, but not grubby. The rooms are huge! we were jetlagged on arrival & i had one of the best sleeps ever in those beds, AMAZING so comfortable! the breakfast room is small, but adequate. food very good, but pricey. Staff ever so friendly, highly recommend it, but ask for a room woth a veiw. will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “another Grand Dame fallen on hard times”
Reviews.Author: lionelpoitrine
Reviews.Content: It's absoluterly criminal to ruin such a great place. What was once the standard bearer for New England hospitality is so utterly banal as to make me want to cry. Cheap and poorly selected furniture. Bathroom was gray and bleak. Housekeeping not really on the job if there's no bath mat. Not an uplifting experience. Not even an ipod dock to cheer up my room, a tinny clock radio...is this a Holiday Inn? Room was next to a service corridor that didn't help.....

Reviews.Title: “A real estate deal waiting to happen”
Reviews.Author: Nycmelanie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august 2009 and loved it. The taj had restored the old elegance, opulence and service of the original ritz. What happened in a little more than a year?the hotel is undeerstaffed, run down and the cost cutting is so obvious it's ludicrous there's cheap, rough toilet paper. In the bathrooms, a bare minimum of toiletries, we remembered some splendid art in the halls now replaced with prints, torn seat cushions, the piano in the grill gone, two waiters in the grill, curtains that are dirty, wilting under scale flowers in the lobby. But it is the ritz. The walls are plaster. The rooms are quiet and the memories of the past give it a shabby elegance. We suspect the taj is in a holding operation, offering some of the best room deals in Boston, until a condo developer gives them their price and they pull out counting their money and. Boston loses another great landmark

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious experience”
Reviews.Author: tennisbird
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was just lovely. It was a surprisingly elegant, but under-stated experience. The chandeliers, rooms, everything is beautiful and stunning. I felt like a visiting dignitary. Only issue was when the concierge recommended a restaurant, she didn't really understand my specific food issues. No major harm done. After breakfast was delivered, they called to see if everything was satisfactory. It was, indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: SJB24_10
Reviews.Content: In spite of its prime location and formerly being Ritz Carlton, Taj Boston was in a sorry state of affairs. The room and bathroom were spacious but not well kept. Hotel staff was discourteous and lacked product knowledge. The only saving grace there were the car parking attendants. I was extremely disappointed as expected Taj to live up to its standards it has in India and perhaps elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charm, Class..... Oh, and a View to DIE FOR”
Reviews.Author: SayafK
Reviews.Content: Booked the Taj through LHW and was upgraded from an internal room to a corner "external suite"..... WHAT A DIFFERENCE!! Room 409 was a dream suite in the corner of the builiding overlooking the Park and it's stunning foliage/landscaping on one side, and Newberry Street on the other!! Perfection in location (steps away from the Arlington stop off the Green line), comfort, size and attention to detail. Carpet and curtain mounts needed some TLC but the Old World charm, location, view and FABULOUS STAFF more than made up for it. Food (esp. breakfast) was WAYY overpriced (even for a Hotel of this caliber), but the French Press Coffee was "Perfection in a Cup".... All in all, it was a trip I will forever cherish, and much of it has to do with the Taj's location, staff and yes the view from room 409 while sipping on the French Press by the window.... Will return one day....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, with amazing deco. The rooms are amazing appointed and spacious, with very attentive staff. Great business facailities, and the concierge, bell staff were fabulaous, nothing was too much trouble. A couple of comments. The bathroom supplies could have been improved given this is a 'Leading hotel of the world' and reception staff were not always available. The operator phone connection for the hotel were not too friendly, but these are slight issues to what was a great stay. Word of warning. International phone call rates form the room are insanely expensive. A 3 minute call to my IT service desk back home cost me 32 USD. I nearly fell off my chair when i got the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Fine Choice”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: I lived for many years outside of Boston, the city that was the bastion of New England propriety (and solemnity). I recall with joy taking my young daughter to events at the Ritz Carlton, celebrating such pre-decadence-age icons as Curious George and the Ducklings for whom you were to make way. The Ritz was your properly aging grandmother; always comforting, always reminding you quietly to enjoy your stay in stately surroundings. But being New England, it was not grandiose, and with age came signs of slight fraying at the edges. That's probably why the Ritz group bailed on the infrastructure, chose to move to new digs across the garden and common, and see if what used to be referred to as the combat zone could be reinvigorated. Ah, the early and mid 2000s. So, along came Taj and chose to stick with the tried and true. I stayed for one night recently, at a very nice rate plan, and found the new owners to be loyal to the conservative vision. The service levels are up to Taj standards, there's been some cleaning and spiffing, but the Taj still reminds me of the old Ritz Carlton, and the new Ritz Carlton suggests a strange dream sequence. It's stately, convenient and helpful. The location is superb. And if you're like me, you'll look at some of the "improvements" (like glazed vinyl window inserts) and smile, knowing that they mean nothing to the old grandmother that is the Ritz....

Reviews.Title: “I love the Taj”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel1955
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice - staff was incredibly nice - location is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my teenage daughter at the end of trip through New England to tour schools. I have stayed at this hotel numerous times in the past when it was the Ritz. It was a lovely hotel in a great location with impeccable service. The Taj chain has completely ruined one of the gems of Boston. Let's start with what was good. The hotel commands a great location right on the Public Garden - within easy walking distance of shopping in the Back Bay and all of the wonderful restaurants and small shops in Beacon Hill. Some of the lobby staff and room service personnel who pre-date the Taj takeover, are still as wonderful, helpful and gracious as always. I should also mention the bed was super comfy. What was wrong: We arrived at 4pm on a Saturday afternoon after a long day of driving. Check-in is at 3pm. We were told that our room was not ready and probably would not be ready for at least another hour, possibly longer. There were a number of people (many with small children) milling around the lobby (which is on the smallish size) who were in the same predicament. Apparently, the hotel had allowed a number of guests from the previous evening to utilize a late check out option - which is fine if you have the capacity to accommodate those folks as well as your new arrivals. Obviously, this was not the case. This was a huge inconvenience for us as we had dinner reservations with friends at 6pm and hoped to shower and freshen before going out. The hotel offered us NOTHING for this inconvenience. Not even a "go have a drink in the bar, while we ready your room". Nothing, zero! When we finally were allowed access to our room, it was clear that the room and bathroom had not been updated in 15 years or longer. The blackout coating on the curtains was peeling and completely gone in places so that with the drapes closed there were huge areas where the bright sunlight penetrated the curtains. The windows have not been re-glazed in 30-40 years and if you have a room facing the common it will be very noisy. The telephone system is very old and several times during the night our phone emitted a loud dial tone through the speaker - 1am, 3am and again at 5:30. It was horrible. They also charge $10.75 per day for internet access. There are many nice hotels in this area, which are much nicer and better value. I will not stay here again. Shame on Taj for ruining what was a Boston institution!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: 2far2go111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway... Our room was beautiful and it overlooked the Boston Garden. It was a great hotel - all the staff were very helpful including the doorman who gave some great tips on what to see and where to eat... Boston is a beautiful city - lots to do and see - and it is easy to walk... I highly recommend staying at the Taj - will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury as Always and Spectacular Service with an Oriental Touch”
Reviews.Author: FCM007
Reviews.Content: Assisting to an MIT Sloan Convocation, my stay at the Taj was great. The Hotel keeps its elegance and style, but with spectacular service and an oriental touch. The Concierge made an enormous difference by recommending exactly the restaurants I wanted, getting me the best tables!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: jag552
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. On arrival we were welcomed and given a huge room with good quality funiture comfortable bed and sofa to sit on,and big flat screen TV. Just the job after an 8 hour flight. We even had a newspaper delivered every morning. The location was great, just on the corner of Newbury Street and on the edge of the Common. Service was very good although the atmosphere was a bit formal, as you might expect in a hotel of this class. We were here off peak season so the price we paid was very reasonable. Eating and drinking was quite expensive, a full breakfast for two came to about 70 dollars but good quality. You could also borrow umbrellas if needed, useful for the first day when it was pouring with rain, luckily the weather improved after that. On the whole, a memorable hotel and a memorable stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Love Boston-This Hotel is too Busy”
Reviews.Author: Benjy56
Reviews.Content: Great location, Place is too busy and noisy with multiple Affairs on weekends. The staff is great but the hecticness of the place ups your adrenaline level. The breakfast is also great but the service takes forever. Loved the Louis IV better

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Machaca_Hill_Lodge
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the city withing walking distance to everything. The hotel is a classic, with beautiful rooms and a delightful staff - not to mention a perfect little breakfast restaurant right downstairs. I liked being in the center of the city and found this location perfect for getting to meetings while at the same time taking in some of the city sites.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice with exceptions !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bird069
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Taj for 4 nights, when we arrived I thought it looked really nice the inside was plush and I was really pleased, but when ir came to checking in it wasn't so good, the gentleman receptionist wasn't very welcoming and he left us standing at the desk for 20 mins while he proceeded to do something else. Eventually we were booked in but the room although very nice did not have a safe which was surprising considering it does state in their customer information pack that all rooms do have a safe. The hotel was exceptionally clean, the conceiege was funny & friendly but the rest of the staff were a tiny bit stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: DC_travellers
Reviews.Content: So, I had stayed here when it was the Ritz. Unfortunately, things have gone down hill a bit. The rooms are tired and dated-old carpets, wall paper, etc. While the location is still great, I will be looking for another place to stay the next go-around.

Reviews.Title: “1st class luxury and very friendly and helpfull staff, well done to you all.”
Reviews.Author: Breadl5
Reviews.Content: This was an excellant hotel with very friendly staff and first class service. For some of the party this was a first visit to America and we all had a great time and were very impressed with the good manners and friendly locals, can't do enough to help. Thanks .

Reviews.Title: “When I booked the Taj, I thought that it...”
Reviews.Author: Drumfunksta
Reviews.Content: When I booked the Taj, I thought that it would be a great place to stay. It was formerly a luxury hotel with a fantastic location and the prices were reasonable, compared to other Boston luxury hotels. The rooms were nice enough but my issue was with the service and their inability to deal with problems. When we got to our room, there was a leak in the bathroom ceiling over the tub. We called down and they said that they'd fix it and bit to worry...so we went out. We got back late and in the middle of the night when my wife went to use the bathroom, she stepped into a large pool of water as the leak was now running down the mirror onto the floor! When we called the front desk the only question we got was, "do you want to use another room to shower?" Are you kidding me?!!! When I asked for a new room the sent up a new key and made no effort to even help us move. They didn't even apologize for the mis-hap. I'm nit looking free stuff, simply an acknowledgement that they caused a situation that made my stay less than pleasant. If you stay at the Taj...roll the dice and best of luck. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Great Location, Substandard Service”
Reviews.Author: No_Name20L
Reviews.Content: When it comes to service, the TAJ misses the details. First the positives: (1) Great location, (2) nice property, (3) courteous valets and bell captains. Now the negatives: (1) service in room is substandard. With the maid service, they try to be cute and clever, and end up being annoying. For example, we arrived in the evening. By then the maid has placed chocolates in the room and left the radio on to "tell us she had been there." We have seen this in other end high hotels as well. The problem is that each hotel has a different radio, and the radios are so complicated mere mortals can't figure out how to turn them off. As near as we could tell, we have to hit CTRL/ALT/Delete while simultaneously holding down F9, the Shift Key, and the letter Q. We just unplugged the radio after spending five minutes trying to figure how how to turn the it off. Quit trying to be cute and just leave the damn radio off. Another example: they close the drain the bath tub, but the tub design is so clever, there is no obvious way to open it, other than stick your hand in 3 inches of water and pry it out. Just leave the drain open. A third example: the designer marble bathrooms have pedestal sinks. It may look great it Architectural Digest, but don't the morons who design these rooms realize that travelers always have toiletry bags? A pedestal sink has no place to put the bag. Two travelers equals two bags. We could put one of the bags on top of the toilet tank, and then have it plop into the toilet. Lovely. Give us sinks with flat surfaces where we can put our stuff. Forth example: No plugs in the room. We travel with Blackberry's, computers, cell phones. If you don't have sufficient outlets, at least put a power strip in the room. Earth to management: design the hotel with travelers in mind. Skip the restaurant. We made the mistake of having breakfast there the last morning. The service was horrible. The food was served at glacial speeds, our waiter did the vanishing act, and we have to rely on waiters at adjacent tables to get us coffee refills. You get better service at the DMV when you go to renew your drivers license. The hotel is actually a very nice place. They just miss the details in terms of service. That is not what I expect for a high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, That Was Unexpected!”
Reviews.Author: HLStride
Reviews.Content: Mt wife and I stayed at the Taj Boston from July 16, 2010 through July 18, 2010. We were visiting our daughter and it was her request to stay at the Taj as she had been impressed by its looks while she was out and about in Boston. We reserved a 1 Bedroom suite and asked for a rollaway for our daughter. On our arrival at the Hotel, we were greeted by a doorman who gave us a receipt for our car as well as our luggage. The front desk personnel were unkempt but polite and check in went smoothly until the bellman frantically began to ask us questions about our luggage. It seems he had some how given our bags to someone else and was trying to reconstruct what was and was not ours and where the bags may have ended up. Eventually they made their way to our room. The room was small, dusty and looked worn. The only portion that appeared to be up to grade was the small but well appointed bathroom. At 5:00am on our first morning our room phone rang. It was the front desk. the cheerful voice at the other end of the line said... "Good Morning!, your Bellman is on his way up to your room!". Super, I thought. Except that we were not expecting either a Bellman or a 5:00 am wake up call. The hotel itself seemed a bit rough around the edges and our room in particular lacked certain things you might expect from a Hotel of this type, clean floors for one. Second, we took a cushion off the armcair in our room after we had spilled some water on it only to find a huge blood stain on the other side of the cushion. Nice. On our second and last evening we heard a knock on our door at around 11:00 pm and were surprised to find a Hotel staffer waiting with some spray equipment and large rubber gloves on his hands. He asked;"Did you call to have your room sprated?" We had not. I have ko idea what he might be spraying for but I felt itchy until I got home to Chicago. In sum, the stay was a bust and I would never recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, good quality service and room, average staff”
Reviews.Author: parmantom
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a suite at a busy period so my stay was outstanding,decor and comfort was 1st class. Found reception to be rather small, not a bad thing per se, but reception staff were decidely average for a fancy place. Having visited other hotels on this visit,i would estimate there would be better top end hotels available. I was aghast that for a posh hotel there was a fee for internet access - outrageous capitalisation of guests!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and value in an older property”
Reviews.Author: jeff3545
Reviews.Content: This building was the Ritz Carlton. Service and furnishings at the Taj are excellent, in some ways superior to what Ritz is doing with its newer properties. The bar is a great space, and the Cafe was quite good. The rooms are on the small side, and the bathrooms are very small, probably explaining why Ritz built a new building. But, the tradeoff is a great hotel experience at a much lower price than the Ritz or the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, some glitches re billing”
Reviews.Author: taos
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay at the Taj Hotel. Wonderful concierge. Stayed there with an American Express cardmember deal that involved a room upgrade (lovely view of Public Garden and very nice room!), $40 breakfast credit each day & 1 free dinner. Everything was very positive till checkout, where it seems an internet charge was doubled for the same day, and the credits for breakfasts & dinner didnt materialize. The desk clerk thought the reductions had already been taken and had no way to check. Upon referral to the billing dept. for checking against receipts, discovered none of the credits had been taken. Straightened out eventually. Only other issue - restaurant service got a bit brisk & inattentive once waiters discovered you had the AmExp deal, and it seems chintzy to charge for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and comfort at Taj Boston”
Reviews.Author: symdd
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Taj Boston--we were in town for our nephew's wedding. All the out-of-town family stayed here and it was also where they had the reception. The room was very clean and beautifully decorated and had a great view overlooking the Public Gardens; beds and pillows very comfortable. Great service from everyone: housekeeping was outstanding; in addition to regular service in the morning they also tidied up in the evenings and left chocolates and bottled water. The concierges were very helpful and knowledgeable. Reception meal and service was stellar--mixed greens for salad; fillet of beef that melted in your mouth; excellent champagne; yummy cake. A wonderful place in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Esighed
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and our room was not ready when we checked in. Got a gardens view room on 6th floor and waited 5 hours for our luggage to get up from the bellman. They apologized but it got worse. We asked if our daughter could get a rollaway bed for the 2nd night and they said yes. When we got back to our room no rollaway, they were all out. We asked if they could send something for our daughter to sleep on so they sent 1 blanket and 1 pillow. She was not happy. They comped us on parking ($42 per day.) The rooms are luxurious and the view on 17th floor is great. I might try it again because it's close to my son's apt. but don't ask for anything extra --you won't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but WORN OUT.”
Reviews.Author: FiveDiamondTraveler
Reviews.Content: No doubt this hotel maintains a great location, but our room was worn out. Needs to carpet and furnishings. Staff is aloof and concierge service is poor. Here's a plus, upon checking in, we had to wait three hours because our room was not ready. For your money, choice the Four Seasons. Especially if you can afford it. Don't forgot they offer some deals now. We had a cocktail at the FS and was sick we were booked at the Taj. What a shame. Lots of potential, but please upgrade your rooms and give your personnel an attitude adjustment. Also - poor exercise facility and no pool at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oldfashioned Charm”
Reviews.Author: ABloem
Reviews.Content: Location is great, very central, as well as close to the subway. It's one of those old-fashioned charming luxury hotels and you really do feel looked after by the staff. Nice touches, like the turn-down service where they also arrange the slippers next to the bed and fill the cooler with ice cubes. Still want to go here with my girlfriend some day, so she can order from the "bath menu" in a room with a fireplace! It's the former Ritz-Carlton, and has the charm of an old hotel that's been around. The rooms aren't the largest ever, there's no pool, in short, this is not a resort in the Caribbean. If you don't care for character, just bland luxury, you should maybe pick another hotel. If you're lucky you can get a great rate well below the Westin and others, which are fine, but very bland in comparison; I'd pick the Taj any time over those. Laundry service did mess up with returning my shirts too late, though (which is annoying on a business trip); but this was faultlessly corrected by having a cab bring them over to where I was having my meetings! And I wasn't charged. Exactly what I expect in a great hotel -- it's not about being without mistakes, it's how you take care of them when something goes wrong. The Taj did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Best In Boston”
Reviews.Author: summerrhi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend stayed here for a long weekend in June. We were upgraded to a beautiful room with a view of the park. The staff was wonderful. There was a boil warter warning on our last day and the hotel promptly provided all guests with a generous amount of bottled water while everyone else was fighting for it in the stores. Parking was a bit pricy (as expected) but we were able to find street parking a block away. Overall, we had a fabulous stay there and I wouldn't hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - terrible terms”
Reviews.Author: lloydell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time staying at the Taj while in town for a family engagement. The rooms were beautiful, the staff was friendly and attentive along with an excellent location to the best areas of Boston. My one true complaint with this hotel chain and something I wish I had been told before making this reservation concerns their room cancellation policy. Be aware that if you decide for any reason to cancel your reservation within 30 days of your expected stay - they will still charge you the FULL room rate. I usually understand the need for hotels to have some form of cancellation policy but 30 days seems extremely excessive and frankly criminal. If you plan a trip to boston and want to stay at the taj - just make sure you actually go.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Stay”
Reviews.Author: SWTwo15
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the heart of town. Conveniently located, at least for my business purposes, and near the Commons. Lots of restaurant options within walking distance. The place is meticulously cared for, clean and comfortable. I do wish they would reconsider their antiquated policy on internet access. I find it amusing when a hotel catering to business clientele, in this day and age, post a daily fee on internet access. Also, they were apparently changing the computer program they use for check-in as it took a considerable amount of time and 2-3 persons looking over the desk clerks shoulder to complete the process. I am sure this issue will be a non-issue in a week. The room was slightly smaller than expected but very comfortable. Quiet air conditioning system, large comfortable bed. Larger than expected bathroom facilities. The work station was marred a bit by not having a logically located electrical outlet, and, in fact, with the predominance of laptops hotels should creatively and abundantly provide these access points, but that is sacrificed when one stays at a more traditional and long-exisiting building. All in all, a nice stay, courteous staff, nice location....

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to rest & play”
Reviews.Author: inju
Reviews.Content: If you want one place to rest & relax with family, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: theamericannomad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Taj a few times now and the service is different each time, sometimes great sometimes average. It's location is unbeatable in Boston and the rooms are nice (in our opinion the beds are amazing). The best thing about the hotel is looking over the common and being able to walk right out to newbury street, or to walk downtown if you are there for work. I can't give it 5 stars at the price they charge for the hit or miss service, but you certainly won't be disappointed by the location!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT luxe. Better off elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: catSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Taj for 5 nights on a recent business trip. The hotel is well located, right on the corner of the Boston Commons (park) and Newbury Street (shopping). Unfortunately, all that is good about the hotel ends here. The room I stayed in lacked what I would expect at a SLH hotel - no electronic safe, no separate shower, no kettle in room, no digital temperature control. The bathroom was so cramped you had to close the door in order to use the WC. There was absolutely no space in the bathroom to place toiletries. When I asked for hot water from room service, I was told that hotel policy required I be charged for it. Outrageous considering you get hot water at 3* hotels. The bar and lounge areas are old fashioned, dark and dreary. Perhaps there are nicer rooms somewhere in this hotel but based on what I saw this was a tired old hotel pretending to be glamorous without any decent amenities. Seriously there are far better chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: topaccommodations
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at various hotels in Boston, including the Fairmont Copley Plaza, the Omni, and the Westin, among others, I thought I would try a hotel in a slighter higher category. This hotel is perfectly situation on the edge of the Boston Common and Newbury Street shopping. The premier rooms with park view are especially spacious in comparison to comparable accommodations in Boston, luxurious and warm, adorned with rich fabrics, and great colors. The public spaces are equally well-done, and have maintained their classic style but now exude warmth and richness. One negative: The Restaurant was exceedingly slow. The service - from door man, front office, concierge, and housekeeping was overall excellent. All in all - clearly a four star hotel that could be even better if the restaurant were improved.

Reviews.Title: “I could have Stayed forever!”
Reviews.Author: caralex
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - the staff were fabulous and I mean fabulous and I am so picky. Every person's desire to please was evident - the Ames could learn management here for sure! Quiet room, fab tub, delicious sheets and bed. Bar was great ,room service perfect. Everything top line.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: YoshiDus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Taj Boston and I reately appreciate the Hotel and my entire stay here. There are of course at least 3 hotels in my mind that will top the Taj (Mandarin Oriental, Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton), but the Taj comes very close to them on just a fraction of what you will pay in the other hotels. The front-desk service was always nice an polite and tried to meet all my needs. Especially Davide from the front-desk was doing a great job, even after several extraordinary requests and a room-change on my request. Sorry Davide, but Europeans are espcially prone to air-conditions. The rooms itself are nicely decorated and absolute clean. They are not top-modern, but have a lot charme. One of the highlights is the location right on Newburry Street and acrcoss the Boston Common park. You will easily access all major sites in Boston by foot from here. Service is always friendley. A great plus was the Concierge team, that managed some excellent reservations to some of the best Boston restaurants. The only negative was the Breakfast. It was way to expensive for only a petite selection. After the first morning my colleague and I decided to have breakfast at another hotel, where we paid only a fraction and had unlimmited buffet-breakfast. Otherwise I enjoyed my stay here very much and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MAC0006
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant hotel with a superb location for very trendy shops and restaurants and also overlooks Boston Common. The restaurant is delightful with excellent service. Altogether this was the best hotel during our stay in the USA, which included several 5* hotels. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, experienced...”
Reviews.Author: Aquacarpet
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, experienced & friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “What great everything”
Reviews.Author: Bloodinc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a leisure trip to Boston and stayed at the Taj. Our room overlooked the Boston Gardens (Duck Pond) What a wonderful view. The service was wonderful and the staff was there to do everything you needed, from recomending a resturant to securing a reseveration, and then sending a letter to your room, with the time, address, and best way to get there. What great service. When we return to Boston we will go no further than the Taj.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest management with no regard for the customer”
Reviews.Author: LarrySwanson
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at the Taj with my wife for Valentine's Day. We booked through AmEx Platinum's Fine Hotels & Resorts. To make a long and boring story short, the hotel tried to rip us off for $100 in food charges, and refused to back down when I pointed out their error. Stay very far away from this hotel. The experience was insulting and infuriating. The package I booked included a suite, dinner for two and breakfast for two, excluding tax, tip, and alcohol. When I checked out, the hotel had applied an $85 credit to my dinner bill and a $40 credit to my breakfast bill, and charged me for the remainder (about $205). When I complained, the woman at the front desk handed me a printed card explaining that the dinner for two could cost a maximum of $85 (on what planet was that going to happen?!) and the breakfast a maximum of $40. This card had the Taj and AmEx logos on it. I went back to my reservation e-mail and the AmEx and Taj websites. No mention of those limits. I called AmEx. They had never heard of the limits, and their reservations system indicated that the package included dinner and breakfast, less alcohol, tax and tip, just as the website indicated. I called the Taj to complain and, at their request, e-mailed them a screen shot of my reservation and the AmEx website, which reflected no limits. The Taj broke off communication with me at that point, and started to communicate directly with AmEx. They sent AmEx a fax (later shown to me by AmEx) claiming that I had received all benefits to which I was entitled--without mentioning the e-mail I had sent proving just the opposite. AmEx also told me that the Taj reported that I had been informed of the limits at check-in. That was an expedient lie. (And since when can the Taj change the terms of an offer AFTER you have booked it and shown up at check-in? The whole thing reeks of dishonesty and sharp practice.) Ultimately, AmEx credited me the difference, and apologized to me for the Taj's misconduct. The Taj has never apologized. As of today, the bogus offer is still on AmEx's website. One wonders how many people have been sucked in by this offer, then stiffed out of their free meals. (To be fair, the non-management employees were really great. The food was excellent, our room was gorgeous, the restaurant management was superb. If the owners got new senior management, this would be a fine hotel. As it stands, it was the worst customer service experience I have had in a long time.)

Reviews.Title: “Get club access - a world of difference”
Reviews.Author: ValuesGoodValue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Taj for 5 nights mainly for the fantastic location. The Arlington T stop is a block away and you can get anywhere using the T. The hotel is classy and clean. Our room was nothing fancy - just a normal room with a small bathroom. What made our trip was the club level room which was staffed with people intent on providing world class service. Brett and Maumud (sp?) became our friends after five days and were willing to do anything we needed to make our stay the best. They worked with the front desk to get us fabulous tickets to shows, gave us dining ideas, and answered most any question we had about Boston. All this while serving tasty snacks and drinks all day. Drinks in the club room make it worth the extra price. Wine in the bar downstars starts at about $12, so it doesn't take too many of those to make it up. The booze is top quality, but again, the service in the club room was the best we ever had. That being said, the doormen and wait staff in the bar were a bit standoffish, so we usually just headed upstairs. We will stay there for sure next time we're is Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service, Unfriendly Manager Ruined 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: boston234
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at this hotel for my friend's 40th birthday. It was supposed to be a nice getaway for four girlfriends to celebrate a special birthday. We checked in to our rooms around 5:30 p.m. with plans to get ready for a special evening out. We had dinner reservations at 7 p.m. When we arrived in our rooms we found that the hotel had given us the wrong rooms. We had reserved two rooms with two queen beds in each. Instead our rooms each had one king. We called the front desk to let them know of the mistake and they said there were no other rooms available and there was nothing else they could do. We insisted that they find an alternative for us. The man at the front desk told me he was the manager and asked me to give him 5 minutes and he said he would call back. He did not call back for 10 min. I finally called him back. At that point he said again there was nothing he could do. Again - we insisted that he make some sort of adjustment for the mistake. He said he was busy and could I call back later??? To make a long story short - he eventually offered us two suites that still each only had king beds. We decided to take the option even though what we really wanted was the two beds in each room which we had reserved. We moved all of our luggage up to the 16th floor with no offer of help from the front desk. Upon arriving in our new rooms, we discovered that one of the suites only had a full-sized bed not a king or even a queen. So now we were worse off than before. We called the front desk and explained the situation and asked to go back to our old rooms where at least if we had to share beds, they were king size beds...and not full-sized. We were told that those rooms were no longer available. At this point, we were already late for our dinner reservation and had not had time to shower and change as we had planned. We complained to the guy who originally said he was the manager." He had the real manager call us back and this guy was no better. Instead of being apologetic and polite, he was very curt and not apologetic in the least. He asked us to explain the situation once again and had to nerve to admonish us for speaking quickly on the phone as we were rushing to try to make our dinner reservation. When I explained that the situation was making us late for dinner, the manager said I don't see how this bedding issue has anything to do with your lack of preparedness time!!!! Again I explained that we had been moving between rooms and have been on the phone with his staff for the past hour. At this point, we were about to loose our dinner reservation. We were already quite late. The hotel was quickly ruining a 40th birthday celebration for four moms who rarely have the opportunity to get away for an evening. Ultimately, the manager came up with another room that had a king bed so we had to move rooms yet another time. When it was all said and done - we were in FIVE different rooms. The hotel never apologized. The manager was very snooty and rude. To make matters worse, they charged my credit card with an additional $600 to cover any expenses that might have been incurred???? I called to question this and the hotel said they standardly run a $150 charge on a guest's card to cover any additional costs and that they then refund the charge if not used. In my case, they charged $150 X 4 -- four times for a total of $600. This did not need to be a disastrous stay. All it would have taken would have been a little competency from the guy at the front desk who claimed to be the manager and some level of customer service from the real manager who had quite an attitude. That said, the bellhops, valets and other service people were super nice and courteous. They could not have been more pleasant. Unfortunately, management was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “sure agree with previous review re service”
Reviews.Author: platinummedallion
Reviews.Content: upon checkin, front desk couldnt find my reservation by my name until I presented my confirmation number (and only then it took a second front desk staffer to do so). When a fire alarm went off throughout hotel, guests who went to front desk were told they should evacuate "if alarm going off on their floor" (it was going off on all floors). I left a "please make up room sign on my door when left early in am, and upon arriving late at night found a note under door saying, "we respected your wishes not to disturb you," and did not make up room. room and "sleep quality" ratings low because of very thin walls, through which one could easily hear neighboring room.

Reviews.Title: “The worse service”
Reviews.Author: Meghna80
Reviews.Content: These guys are very inefficient. First I made a reservation which they confirmed but didn't know about 12 hours before my arrival date. Then they gave me a 5:00 am wakeup call when I hadn't asked for it. After I finished my stay I asked for a bill three times till I had to call them up to get my bill. 6 hours later I see I have been charged twice for the one-night stay. The administrative staff of this hotel needs to change. I've never had such bad service from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sak01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Taj....a great hotel to stay at!!..Great location..one block from subway(green line) which will take you most everywhere..also across from Boston Common and a short walk to Chinatown and a movie theatre. The rooms are top notch....very nice bed and TV...elegant room and bathroom...size of room is quite nice. Nice exercise room and room for free computer use!!! Would return again for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Affair to Remember with the Grande Dame of Boston”
Reviews.Author: RealTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Last week I completed a 28 year pilgrimage to 17 Arlington Street which certainly remains one of Boston's most esteemed addresses today. Overlooking the Public Garden and Boston Common, this hotel remains the very foundation for luxury hotels in America and around the world. To learn more about this legendary hotel, visit http://corporate.ritzcarlton.com/en/About/OurHistory.htm. My last visit to the â€œthenâ€� Ritz Carlton was February 1982 when I was transferred by my company to the west coast and I had no opportunity to return to Bean Town until after the Big Dig was completed. My personal acquaintance with this hotel began in the fall of 1976 when I treated myself to supper in "The Cafe" as a reward for having recently graduated from college and arrived in Boston to begin my professional career. Here I was welcomed and treated as a â€œGentlemanâ€� and over the next few years I continued the tradition of having supper on Friday evenings in The Cafe. After a few weeks I am certain curiosity got the best of the hotel manager and he was curious as to why a scrawny kid was having dinner in his restaurant. Certainly I did not fit the mold as to who was a Ritz Carlton guest. It was certainly evident I did not earn my money the old fashioned way, by inheriting it. Finally one evening the hotel manager approached my table; he introduced himself and welcomed me to his hotel. As it turned Mr. Bennett, the General Manager, grew up not more than thirty miles from where I spent my youth and we had attended the same college, and needless to say, we developed a bond and from that point on I was a â€œsomebodyâ€� when I entered the Ritz and Mr. Bennett knew how to put on the Ritz. James V. Bennett was the quintessential hotelier of his day. He lived and breathed ever y moment of his waking hours in this hotel. After all, he lived in an apartment on top of the hotel and could be seen at any time visiting with staff and inspecting the hotel. Jim always appeared in a smartly tailored Brooks Brothers suit, a fresh boutonniere in his lapel, a crisp white shirt, conservative silk tie, shined shoes, and manicured hands warmly and genuinely greeted his guests by name. In those rare times Mr. Bennett was assisted by the impeccably coiffured Miss. Eleanor O'Niel who knew the likes and dislikes of every hotel guest and had their preferences and personal telephone number committed to her memory. Eleanorâ€™s sister, Ruth, just happened to Mr. Yawkeyâ€™s secretary, owner of the Boston Red Sox. While Jim and Eleanor were conservative and formal, Ruth was at the other end of the spectrum, full of spirit and knew every statistic of every Red Sox ball player in her day by heart. She referred to the ball players as her â€œboysâ€�. For the sake of disclosure, I became a regular to The CafÃ© and often I was invited to join Mr. Bennett, Eleanor and Ruth Oâ€™Niel for Friday supper. On occasion during the summer months Ruth would reach into her handbag and ask me if I could make use of some tickets, tickets that just happened to be along the third base line at the legendary Fenway Park. But I can assure you these tickets did not sway my opinion of this hotel. In those early days of my love affair with this grand hotel, one could not help notice nearly every staff member wore a pair of white gloves and the elevators were operated by staff. The elevators had little needlepoint upholstered benches so â€œLadiesâ€� could be comfortable while traveling in the elevators. Fresh flowers were ever present, the brass and marble floors were highly polished and one could use either as a mirror. The table linens were crisp, tables immaculately set, and silver sparkled as if you were the first person to ever touch the flatware. The menus were professionally printed daily. And when you paid your hand-calligraphied guest check or room bill, your change was always new crisp, clean uncirculated bills and coinage. Back then the food was classic French, paying homage to the founder of Ritz Hotels, the incomparable Cesar Ritz and his business partner, legendary Chef Auguste Escoffier. One lesson Mr. Bennett instilled in me was his basic rule of quality,â€�You can judge a hotel by its croissants at breakfast and the pate at dinner.â€� It took some time; but, I now know what he meant and that rule remains applicable in my book. So what was different 28 year later? Not much. As I noted, I had not been back into this hotel for over two decades. I was aware the hotel had been closed and totally renovated. The heads at Marriott Hotels, made the decision to open a new shinny glass and more contemporary Ritz Carlton on the opposite side of the Boston Commons, in the middle of what was once known as the â€œCombat Zoneâ€�, a rather unsavory area in Boston for many years. For several years both Ritzâ€™s co-existed. Then a couple of years ago India based Taj Hotels expanded into America with the purchase of 17 Arlington Street. The lions head and cobalt blue entrusted to Ritz Carltonâ€™s identity was erased. Ironically, the Taj Hotel Boston remains true to the original Ritz Carlton ideals, even more so than todayâ€™s Ritz Carlton Hotels. Call me old fashioned; but, I really enjoy the standards and traditions of elegant older hotels than many of todayâ€™s superficial polished chrome and glass hotels. The Taj Hotel Boston remains a wonderful experience. Times and economics have forced change upon this Grande Dame, just like every other hotel in America and most of the world, but at this hotel it was not very distinguishable. I was saddened to discover the regal â€œDining Roomâ€� on the second floor was now used as a ballroom. I understand dining requirements have changed along with demand; but, nevertheless, generations will never have the experience of servers in white ties and tails swirling around this elegant space capped off with its sparkling crystal chandeliers with cobalt blue decorations. As sad as it was to see this space no longer used for dinner, I was delighted to see the elegance of afternoon tea in â€œThe Loungeâ€� remains to this day. If one is not staying at the Taj, one should make every effort to indulge in afternoon tea. The accommodations were lovely. Though renovated just several years ago, the treatment reminded me of my stays back in the 1980â€™s. The crystal chandeliers in the corridors sparkled. The Frette bed linens and terrycloth bath lines were scrumptious. There was certainly no cutback or savings when it came to all the amenities offered in the bathroom. Even small packets of Woolite were on hand in case you needed to hand-launder your â€œdelicatesâ€� in the privacy of your room. Turn down was wonderful, complete with a linen floor mat so your bare feet did not have to touch the deep pile carpet before slipping into your Taj terrycloth slippers. The housekeepers were elegantly attired in classic black dresses with crisp white aprons. Even the housekeepers dressed for evening at this hotel. The only concern I would address is the lack of attentiveness of the staff in â€œThe Barâ€�. To be greeted at the door, seated and then forgotten, is not what Cesar Ritz or Jim Bennett would have ever tolerated. And I did not like, as well. The bottom line is simply this, at least once in your life you should treat yourself to a stay at the Taj Hotel Boston. I dare say you might want to experience this classic hotel sooner than later so that you can be a more informed judge as to what quality and service represents in a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High priced, Clean, Friendly, And Great staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: summerloved
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the Taj located on newbury street and loved it! from the moment we pulled up and were greeted by the vallet attendents to the looby staff and maids, the glits and glammer was all over, it cathes your eye. the hotel is big with only 15 floors and a roof-top garden, a beautiful state of the art fitness center and a Chanel store located in the lobby!! the rooms were nice too with a HUGE bathroom and great beds. overalll. the hotel was Suberb and Serine

Reviews.Title: “rooms are clean and elegant”
Reviews.Author: pcjunky
Reviews.Content: rooms are very clean, nice bedding, friendly staff, great location. no coffee maker in the room, valet parking is $42 for overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable great stay and service.”
Reviews.Author: Timco
Reviews.Content: Location, Service, Everything is top noch What you expect from Luxury Hotel, Taj shows that they are in competition with other Top brands in the area,

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and amazing location! Room so big, thought I had a suite. LOVED this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LauraLeeTravels
Reviews.Content: I lucked out when I booked a mystery 4 Star hotel in the heart of Copley Place on an online booking site. The Taj Boston was truly a marvelous place to stay. Impeccable service, large beautiful room and a location you can't beat. The service was impeccable from the moment we checked in. The concierge was very friendly and knowledgable and offered great tips. The room itself was truly amazing. I seriously thought we must have mistakenly be given a suite. (which was great since we were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday!) There was a huge four poster bed and a beautiful antique style living room set. (big couch, chair, coffee table and desk.) The bathroom featured a huge garden style tub and had a large seperate room with a sink and vanity area.They have a pillow delivery service where you can pick the style of pillow you want (free of charge!) This location is truly to die for, too. We walked EVERYWHERE in no time at all! (to a Red Sox game, to the start of the freedom trail, to the Cheers bar--which is about a block away--to amazing shopping, even to the start of our Duck Tour.) The best part is that the hotel is behind the park, right where the swan boats are. So you are right by everything but you still have a nice view of trees and don't have the feeling that you're just surrounded by corporations. The hotel is a little pricey but not that much more than other hotels in the area. If you want to splurge a little and go all out on a trip to Boston, I would highly recommend doing it at the Taj! Oh and our cab driver told us that he heard all the Yankee players stay there when they come into town... So if you're a fan of the Yanks, you'll feel right at home. :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service; incredible location”
Reviews.Author: dijas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Taj for a week in October and had a fantastic experience. Since we were staying for several days, we paid for the Club level upgrade and it was completely worth it. The food and drinks in the Club room were fantastic and the service was outstanding. Overall, the service at every level of the hotel was fantastic - from the front desk, to the concierge, to housekeeping - service was never overlooked. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small, but the tub was very deep so it was easy to take a very luxurious bath. Housekeeping was thorough and the room was always clean. The business center is small (two computers), so if you don't have your laptop, you may have to wait for a computer. Depending on your schedule, this may or may not be a big deal. The location is fantastic. Since it's at the top of Newbury, we had our pick of really nice restaurants in the area or a short T-ride to the North end. So, I don't know what the hotel restaurant is like. However, we did order late night room service once, and it was solid. Hard to complain about 24 hr room service, since it's getting harder and harder to come by. The mini-bar could have been stocked with more boutique snacks and liquor, but that's pretty minor. A $3.75 Sam Adams is a pretty good deal at nearly any bar, and especially a hotel mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service - but extra charges on bill”
Reviews.Author: tosha25italia
Reviews.Content: We went to the TAJ during the weekend of the Boston Marathon in April and were traveling with a 2 month old. At first, our TV was not working properly, and they sent someone immediately to fix it. We also asked for a crib and refrigerator and these were delivered very quickly. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. The service was good - they catered to our needs. We ate breakfast at the restaurant there and the service was decent. Right across the street was the Boston gardens - great location! Walking distance from all of the shops in Copley Square. When we left we noticed several extra charges on our bill which was a bit disconcerting. We cleared it but it took a while and made us feel that they were trying to scam us. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel in the ideal location."”
Reviews.Author: Xoe
Reviews.Content: Our 3-day stay at The Taj Boston was at the end of a wonderful Holland America cruise from Montreal to Boston. The Taj's location could not be better, just across from the Public Garden, with the Boston Common just beyond. Our room, 707, was ideally located facing the Public Garden, with views of the trees, just starting to change color, and a peek of the gold dome of the State House. It was a spacious well-appointed room. The windows actually opened -- fresh air! The hotel staff was unfailingly courteous and helpful. From the Taj you can walk to most of the historic sites. We used the Boston Trolley HO-HO for an overview of Boston, and to get some of the more distant places we wanted to see. Our favorite dining venue was "Finale", about 2 blocks away, where they specialize in incredible desserts, preceded by light entrees called "Preludes". Casual ambiance and perfect dining choices for our tastes.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: acushla52
Reviews.Content: AfterI purchased this hotel on Priceline, I read the reviews and was a little sceptical about what I would find.
