I wanted to be near Newbury street shopping and close to Boston Commons so this was the perfect location. From the moment we aririved and the doorman and valet were both wearing white gloves and swanky uniforms, I knew this was a good choice. We arrived at 1:00 PM and did not have to wait for a room. Also, we were upgraded toa larger room with a bathroom with double vanities. This room was in the newer section of the hotel and our fabulous bellman explained that rooms on that side are larger....especially the bathrooms. We did not have a view, but we were not in Boston to sit in the hotel room and look out the window, we were there to be ouside and experiencing it. The beds were super comfy, the chocolates and turndown service were great, and the bar had awesome Cosmos. I plan on staying at the Taj on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: Bnthere4u
Reviews.Content: Taj Boston is a good location for shopping in a very well kept and desirable neighborhood. We stayed in room 1206 which was spacious with 1 kingsize bed that was only average we did enjoy a great view of "Boston Commons" across the street which we found out must be "dog day" on Sundays- hundreds of people bringing there dogs to the park. Taj has a beautiful lobby, nice workout room on the 4th floor, no pool on the premises, our room did not have a coffee maker in it, heard the door noises from the hall, only parking offered was $42 valet, housekeeping was most gracious and offered free bottled water, bed turndown, and chocolates,the hotel provided complimentary newspaper -New York Times. Overall stay was pleasurable rooms were a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, but a few issues that don't make it a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Shelbs97
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a one night stay to see a concert in Boston. There were 4 of us and we had requested two beds rather than one king. They couldn't accomodate this request and said the only way we could get 2 beds was to pay an extra $50, which we did because we really had no choice. Check in process seemed to take a lot longer than I've experienced at other hotels, probably about 15 minutes at the counter, I'm not really sure why (there was no line). Room was very nice and large. Bathroom was large with double sinks, and the toilet and shower were sectioned off with a door that closed, which was nice since there was 4 of us getting ready. View was okay, nothing spectacular. We were on the 5th floor. Bed comfort was okay, nothing great, I think the beds at the Marriott are MUCH more comfortable. Room got very stuffy at night, we put on the AC in the middle of the night to sleep better, although the AC was slightly louder than I would have expected. We ordered room service at night and I'm pretty sure they didn't knock, as we waited forever, finally called down, and they told us they attempted to deliver with no answer. The food was on a cart outside the room, cold as ice. It was unfortunate, especially for the outrageous room service price, and I was suprised they did nothing to at least partially compensate us. Not even an apology. When trying to get a cab, the doorman pretty much ignored us, which surprised us. A couple came out of the hotel for a cab about 10 minutes after we had started trying for one, and the doorman got them right in a cab. Not sure if it's because they were dressed for dinner while we had on jeans, but regardless, don't judge a book by it's cover, we were going to a concert, of course we weren't dressed up. We still paid to stay at the Taj. Check out went faster, and our car was brought by the valet in about 15 minutes (we called ahead and it was waiting for us outside). Valet price is $42, which seems average for what you'd pay for valet anywhere else in the city Overall, we had a decent time. Hotel is very nice, and with better service I would have rated it better overall. They can't say they're a 5 star without a MAJOR improvement on service, from the front desk to the doorman to room service. We'd go back if we got a great deal, otherwise we'd probably stay at either the Westin Copley or the Intercontinential again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience”
Reviews.Author: JMBINCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Taj Boston for one night on a tour of New England. I had stayed here many years ago when it was the Ritz Carlton, and I am pleased to say the experience still measures up to that time...even though it is now a Taj hotel. The good things about the hotel include: 1. The location. It is right on Boston Common. It is a quick trip to get just about anywhere, from Copley, to Fenway, to the airport. All only minutes away. 2. Very well appointed. The common areas and the rooms are, as you'd expect, very well styled and appointed. You won't be wanting for anything. For instance, you get plush robes, slippers and free bottled water in your room. There is also a very fast wi-fi connection and a ton of cable channels for those looking for electronic entertainment. 3. Great service. Lots of "my pleasures" and "how can I help you"s at this hotel. We didn't have to lift a finger to do just about anything. Our bags were unloaded from our car and delivered to our room while we were checking in. Room service was available 24/7, which was handy given we arrived from the West Coast at midnight. But not all was perfect: 1. The rooms are very tiny. This hotel was built over 100 years ago, when people were apparently a lot smaller. The room was maybe 15' x 15', and felt like a small guest bedroom...made worse by the fact that a lot of furniture was crammed in that small space. And, the bathrooms are so small that you have to close the door before you can get to the toilet. So, don't think you're getting a spacious retreat. 2. The rooms are also quite dark. Our room only had one small window, which they made appear larger by draping it with window treatments three times the width of the window. Decorator trick, apparently. In any case, not much light came into the room, which made the room seem even smaller. 3. Parking is a bit cumbersome. They have a valet service, but they must park the car quite some distance away as they ask you to call for it 30 minutes before you need it. And, believe me, it takes at least 30 minutes for the car to come. 4. Restaurant on site was over-priced and had a disappointing (and overly eclectic) menu. 5. Rates were, of course, higher than was merited by the property. All in all, though, a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “what a grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: lstradal
Reviews.Content: We were 4 women in 1 room . all was wonderful. room was large nicely appointed beds were comfy.brought up coffee pot and coffee!when requested having the bottled water free was great the bathroom was large/two separate rooms. was pricey but you can find package deal. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: BobfromOC
Reviews.Content: What I liked about the Taj Hotel Boston Great Location Very comfortable bed and pillows Excellent Bar and service Check In and Check Out very good staff Needing Improvement Bathrooms to small Turndown service- 1 night yes 2 nights no Free coffee downstairs from 5:30 to 7:00 am. The setup did not differentiate between the caffeine and non caffeine containers. I asked 2 days in a row to the night desk clerk and he answers both times that I think the caffeine is the one on the right but not sure. After 7:00 am it is $3.25 a cup in restaurant. The host in restaurant seemed a little put off getting the coffee Concierge Service- Everybody on Trip Advisor board raved about the great concierge service. This and the location was what drove our decision to stay at Taj hotel. Maybe it was just my wife and I but it seemed like your concierge staff were overworked or disinterested. Either way from our perspective they needed some coaching and or polish. Was unable to get 3 minutes of undivided attention from concierge desk to get some very basic ideas on what to do in Boston. As an example was working with a concierge and he interupts our conversation to see how another guests day was and then walked away from us to attend to the other guests needs while we waited 5 minutes for his return. We finally leave and and come back after dinner. No apology for the behavior. In summary generally stay at 4- 5 star hotels and know the difference between a great hotel and average to good hotel. This is a hotel with a great location, some good employees but do not expect a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMon
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location, is the name of the TAJ. There is simply no better tourist location in Boston. The TAJ staff does an amazing job at providing incredible service too. I did however feel that the quality control for room service was very poor, having recieved both bad oysters and rotted fruit on two different occasions. My other gripe is the size of the bathrooms, but the gustrooms are quite ample. I would stay here again, but do hope that the negatives I witnessed are just anomalies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bdextravels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple times, mainly because of its location to the Boston Common, Beacon Hill, and Newbury Street. The guest rooms our average for a luxury property and I've hadn't had an outstanding service experience while there. The rates can be high, however, the ability to walk to so many great locations is a huge perk when I travel. If your looking for a boston location based hotel, this is it. In terms of the guest rooms, i feel they are above average. Great Concierge services!

Reviews.Title: “No free coffee”
Reviews.Author: jeanstexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 20 years ago when the hotel was the Ritz Carlton on a floor with the concierge service. This time, a vendor took care of the room selection for me (cost too, so no real complaints). The location is still great, but I really missed not being able to make coffee in my room. Yes, I know I could have ordered room service or traveled to the lobby and paid $3.25 for a cup to go; however, I really like a coffee pot in my room. I would stay somewhere less luxurious, but with my favorite convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: shave
Reviews.Content: Thhis is the perfect location to explore Boston. Thee Gardens are across the street, it is on Newberry St(Shopping), kitty Cormer to Beacon Hill(great area to explore) and within walking disctance of Chinatown and the North End. It is pretty ornate for our taste, but the service was outstanding! James is the best concierge we have run across anywhere. He is spot on with his recommendations and has a great personality; ask him anything - he won't cop an attitude! Alas, all good things come at a premium; a c-note for room service breakfeast for 3(continental at that) and $30 for 2 drinks at the bar, but James is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “superb location and service”
Reviews.Author: ArthurLondon
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night at the hotel with my family and we had a great time. The location is perfect for leisure travel and the staff really took good care of all of us. We got upgraded to a suite and really enjoyed the extra room and loved the Taj room upstairs for the extra amenities. Would definitely come back. The only drawback is the furnishings are getting a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff make the Taj a great choice”
Reviews.Author: miller041
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the location was fantastic, right across from the beautiful Public Gardens and close to the Freedom Trail with the historic sights marked along the way. The room was clean and comfortable as expected, not big, but the size was fine, nice sheets and a soft duvet. The bathroom was small but had everything needed, Molton Brown toiletries, a great deep tub. The staff was wonderful, very helpful, from the front desk, the doorman, the concierge, the parking attendant, all 5 star quality employees. Shopping is fantastic in this neighborhood, if you love your top designers, this is the place. Chanel is in the building itself, other similar designers are in the blocks around the hotel. Along the Freedom Trail you find lots of restaurant choices, we particularly liked the large concentration of Italian restaurants in the North End, the casual Neptune's Oyster had a great selection of choice Massachusetts oysters and clams, not cheap, but very, very good. We are choosey about where we stay, this was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: travelopinion-uk
Reviews.Content: The taj in Boston is a nicely run very average hotel. There is nothing specila about the service, decor or amenities and falls a little short on teh luxury side. The staff were friendly enough although a little bored and uninterested. Cleanliness was fantastic though and the housekeeper always asked to see if I was pleased and if I needed anything more. The food was not stable in quality. The first morning the breakfast was nicely cooked and warm. On the second and third day it fell short of a good breakfast and the dishes were ofthen dry and cold. Overall it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong. Nothing All that Right.”
Reviews.Author: GilFennerty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for my anniversary. Can't really complain. It was a perfectly nice stay. But for a luxury hotel, it isn't all that special. Service was very good. Staff was friendly and responsive. Room was nice I guess. Large and in pretty good shape, clean and the bed was comfortable enough. Overall, it feels a little like your grandmother's house. This place is just sorta missing a little magic is all. It's a little past its prime. It's still well maintained. It's still well run. But just doesn't feel special. If you get a good price on a room, it is a nice, well-run place to stay. But compared to other hotels in this class, I'd say its pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Luxurious and Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: Two-Wheel_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for business and needed a hotel near the John Hancock building. The Taj is part of the Leading Hotels of the World group, which tends to be pretty good. The hotel offered a good level of luxury without being pretentious. Staff is extremely friendly and very service oriented. When they screwed up my room (they gave me a room that hadn't been properly cleaned yet) they gave me a triple upgrade to a large suite, which was nice. Location is excellent, being right next to Boston's Public Gardens and on Newbury Street. Check-in was pretty efficient,. The room itself was huge, but that was due to being upgraded. The room I got when I first arrived was pretty normal ... I'd say a good size for a business person or a couple traveling to Boston. Quality of furnishings, beddding, etc. was all excellent, exactly what you'd expect visiting a luxury hotel. Toiletries were all Molton Brown and included nice touches like a shaving kit, toothbrush kit, etc. Room service was excellent. I ordered breakfast and it was at my door in less than 10 minutes. I've never had service that fast before. I took me by surprise. There was plenty of free bottled water, which I appreciated since it was kind of dry with the a/c on. The fitness center was pretty well appointed. Lots of cardio machines. The only minor complaint was that there wasn't much in the way of free weights or universal machines. But very nice and new nonetheless. Internet is the standard affair ... they charge $11 per day or so, which is normal at hotels like this. Did I say the room was huge? I had a sitting room, walk-in closet, bedroom with enough space to have a party. Good-sized bathroom. And an entry way that almost qualified as a foyer. In fact, when traveling I like smaller rooms because they I don't miss anything when I pack up to go. But it was a fun novelty to stay in a big suite like that. The only potential complaint with the room is that there was HVAC equipment nearby that made a humming noise if you stopped and listened. I'm a heavy sleeper so didn't bother me, but for some it could be an issue. Price paid was an excellent value ... I think I paid a little over $200 for a basic level room. Must be the recession.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel would recommend”
Reviews.Author: iam_troy
Reviews.Content: I liked everything abt this hotel. I would highly recommend. its clean, nice location, etc

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: prachhh
Reviews.Content: Big and spacious rooms, good shopping arcade below. Good location too. The hotel is really nice . The staff is very hospitable too. Really nice . RECOMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: szmikedr
Reviews.Content: TAJ is great hotel is a superb location. If you ask for a room with park view than it is specially nice. Rooms are spacious, staff is helpful. I think it is a good choice. Staff is specially helpful in all respect. ,Couple of downsides that if you pay for something in this range, should be aware of. In my room the bathroom was extremely small. This time small means really small (If I was in front of the mirror- dooe cannot be closed). Intrenet was not working properly, although they have solved it quickly. I would advise it to anyone (although check the bathroom in advance :))

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kcplaza2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Taj for one evening on business and couldn't have asked for a nicer experience. The staff were friendly, professional and very helpful. My room overlooked beautiful Boston Commons park, the room had great natural light, big bed, and everything was clean. When I returned from my meeting they turned down the bed, had slippers and a bottle of water. I'd stay at this hotel in a heartbeat. Great location and the building itself has plenty of character.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but expected better”
Reviews.Author: tjhboudoir
Reviews.Content: Service was great. You can't beat the location. My wife, son and I got a suite, and while the room was spacious, you would expect a suite to be a little roomier. There were some disturbing looking stains on the bedskirt, indicating it ad not been changed prior to our arrival. There were a few other minor cleanliness issues, but in the hotel business, if your beds aren't clean.... and you call yourself 5 star? While they did offer valet parking, they charge you $42 a day! Yikes! Shouldn't they have a discounted rate with a garage? That's like normal parking rates if I parked the car myself. Also, who in this day and age doesn't have free internet access? Really?! There were a number of other "little things" which added up. Overall, I felt like this was a 3 or 4 star stay (albeit a great location). They need to bring their cleanliness up to par, and they need to think about their amenities if they want word of mouth. For what I paid, I can't say I'd recommend them to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location , Some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: pffp
Reviews.Content: The Taj's location right on the park and next to Newbury St is excellent. The staff is attentive and the rooms are spacious. However , i did notice some problems that the hotel has to resolve. First of all , i had a problem with the key card access system , every single night i had to go back down to the lobby to have a new key made since mine and my friend's card would not work . Second and most importantly, when you come to the hotel , ask to staiy in the new building because the old building does not have a ac/heat system that allows you to choose the temperature. It was really hot in our room and since it was still winter , only the heat worked. The explanation given to me was that only the heat system works in the winter . A very small fan was put in my room , which didnt make a difference , so i ended up having to sleep with the windows open. This meant i was woken up early in the morning by the birds singing and the cars going by.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ShahRajen
Reviews.Content: What a place to be. you are close to heart of Boston. its a pilgrimage of education. So many IT companies, startups. Fun to be at such place.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware: Miscategorized and is not a 5 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alinka345
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby was beautiful and the size of the room was quite large, nothing about the room, hotel, service, food, etc could be described as a 5 star experience. This hotel was more a 3.5 or 4 star hotel. Let me explain why: Room furniture was very old and decor was bland. Bathroom did not have a sink. You had to come out of the bathroom (use dirty hands to open the door!) and wash hands outside of the bathroom - sink was in the room! We requested milk for in-room service for our baby. They overcharged us intentionally. The menu said $3 for milk. They charged us $10 + delivery! When we called for a straw for the milk the operator gave us attitude. To my horror, the sheets were not 100% clean. TO my disappointment, the bed linen was not 100% cotton - I get allergies if linen is not 100% cotton and start itching. Overall, I'd say this hotel is 100% MISCATEGORIZED AND IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame at heart, but needs a little polish...”
Reviews.Author: Mr.RideDaWave
Reviews.Content: Was up here with the family for a couple of days visting friends and I must say, this property is still a gem, however, getting a bit tired and needing a polishing. We were only in town for a couple of nights but long enough to get a feel of the property. The consensus is that it is still one of the grand dames of new england but a touch up here and there is a must, soon. Rooms were very nicely appointed but you could tell the furniture was older and needs replacing. We were lucky to have a fireplace in our room; there is a menu of different woods you can order that have different smells and crackle levels - very cool. Public areas were beautiful but still, needs a little TLC. Staff was very nice and we looked in on the meeting rooms which were really beautiful. I gave this property 4-stars b/c of expectations; we expected 5-star and the tiredness held us back. But, with 4-stars, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: elicyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Taj Boston on business and was impressed with the staff, room and meeting facilities. Staff were quite courteous and professional. All common areas of the hotel were impeccably clean and presentable. Meals were much better than expected and the room was very clean and spacious. Mine, though standard overlooked Boston Commons and it was nice to do some 'in room sightseeing' from the big comfy chair at the huge windows while relaxing my first day there. I was pleasantly surprised with my accomodation since I expected much less for the standard room rate. The location of the hotel is central making it perfect for sightseeing. The meeting facilities are spacious and more than adequate for large events. I would recommend this hotel to colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Inept with food restrictions”
Reviews.Author: BostonAlex067
Reviews.Content: I took my son who has Celiac's disease for afternoon tea after confirming the Taj Hotel could accomodate his gluten intolerance. Not only did they give him gluten, they kept telling us his food contained no gluten. After he ate some sandwiches, I looked at his food closely and told the waiter that there was no way that the baguette they served him was gluten free. Finally the waiter admitted that the non-Enlish speaking cook didn't understand and it indeed did contain gluten. I was floored because I thought this was a five star restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Exoson
Reviews.Content: Three nights, late October for a trade show at the Hynes. Shopped around, got a great price, less than $200/night. Comfortable room and bed. They upgraded us to a Public Garden view. Service was impeccable. Restaurant was over priced for breakfast. Only meal we had there. $60+ for breakfast for two. Yikes. Walk a few blocks to the Paramount at 45 Charles St. Save's about 60%. Internet access is $10 for 24 hours. Mini-bar price is absolutely outrageous. $5.50 for a half liter of water that you get for $4/case in the supermarket. Trouble with the LCD TV. Called it in and there was a service guy at the door in less than 2 minutes. Compared to other places we checked the price was nearly $100 less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Gold-plated”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property for many years and the service levels continue to decline since being sold to Taj. Room quality is okay but varies by room. Lobby area is pleasant and The Bar is nice in the evening. Service isn't a strong point for this property. A few observations from my own experience over the past few days: - Housekeeping doesn't clean thoroughly (e.g., when I arrived, the desk area still had trash from the previous guest -- but the rest of the room was clean) - My luggage was misplaced after arriving despite the fact that the hotel is noticeably empty. Bellman mistakenly delivered luggage from another guest and then had trouble finding my luggage - Amenities are not replaced regularly (perhaps they are cutting back due to low occupancy?) Lastly, I arrived just before opening time for the hotel restaurant and asked to sit until they opened and was turned away. Fine for a place that isn't supposed to offer good service. The Ritz would have been more flexible. It was a little disappointing. This property is in a great location. The building is attractive. The complementary car service and finishings in the lobby make this feel like a 5-star. However, if you scratch beneath the surface, this property has lost some of its luster. Stay here if you get a great room rate and don't mind a few imperfections. Otherwise, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Holiday Inn (almost)”
Reviews.Author: blgreyes2
Reviews.Content: We had to change rooms because the Bathroom was not cleaned. It was superficially Cleaned but not inspected by anyone with grey matter between their ears. Running a tissue along the base cove tile it became black in 2 feet. New room was the same. Rooms are very basic for what you pay, extra to see the Park too. Holiday Inns are Better nad 1/2 the price. Why bother??

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Terrible Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: buzzby
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a beautiful weekend at the Taj. I adore the location of this hotel. We brought our two Yorkies and we all loved being across the street from the Public Gardens. The hotel is very pet friendly. The staff were amazing in their attitude and helpfulness. Our room faced the park with a window that opened which was wonderful. The room itself is a good size but it is dated with no modern amenities. The bed was outstanding with a great pillow menu. We were lucky to be at the Taj on a Sunday when they had their roof brunch buffet. It was a very special treat. Our only complaint was the problem we had with valet parking. The price is $42.00 per day. We arrived at the hotel on Saturday, apx 3:30 PM and had a late checkout on Sunday, 4:00 PM we expected to pay the $42 parking fee. We called for our car at 3:30 on Sunday to check out of the hotel. We then saw our bill and the parking charge of $42 +$19. We questioned the charge and were referred to a small note on the back of the parking check which said that guests checking out after 2 PM would be charged an additional $19 for parking, even though we were not parked for more than 24 hours. To add insult to injury, we then waited more than 1 hour for our car to arrive. This certainly left us with a very negative experience of the Taj Hotel. The Four Seasons is right near by with a wonderful park location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tom2592
Reviews.Content: We booked the Taj with the idea that it would be a treat and stayed in a standard room over two very wet September days. We made a mistake. The hotel could not be better located; it has all the amenities; and the staff is professional and very well trained. However, our room was amazingly ordinary- blah and matronly describe it well- and the HVAC system was barely able to keep it cool and quite unable to reduce the humidity below 95%. The Taj also lacks the grand public spaces one associates with 5* grand dames. When I looked at pictures of rooms on Tripadvisor, I thought that bad lighting, the internet and the photographer had combined to make them look washed out and went ahead with my reservation. A picture is worth 1000 words and the ones here do not do the hotel a disservice. Our room seemed to have been freshened with new paint and paper, steam cleaning and touch-ups within the last month- so it is not like it was a substandard room waiting for renovation. It was on the smaller side of average with a small but near to perfectly redone marble bathroom. The room was dominated by an over-sized TV armoire (no flat screens here) and sadly the quilted bedspread had not gone in the freshening. Everything, literally everything, was in various shades of a pale, urine yellow. There was only one piece of art, though half a dozen surfaces called for art. The decor lacks a pulled together look, seems to have been designed to impress grandmas and is way short of what you usually get in 4*, never the less 5*, hotels. If you want to treat yourself and be cosseted in sumptuous quality, go elsewhere. We wish we did.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: goodhouse
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful weekend in Boston. What made it memorable, was our stay at the Taj. The employees were so respectful and thoughtful: attending to our every need. Very dog friendly. We went out to dinner and thought the dog would be fine alone in the room for 2 hours, but when we got back, he was gone. I guess someone complain about his crying and the head of security came and got him. Walked him until we got back. So awesome. The room was huge. The bathroom was beautifully done. You can't beat the location; accross the street from the commons. Been to many hotels, and this was the best experince so far.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: sug314
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Taj for 4 nights with another couple in a different room. The rooms were very stuffy and hot. The bathroom is VERY small......bed is HORRIBLE.....and the TV was an old tube. For the money ($500/night) and since we did stay in the Marriott at Copley Place for a few night prior......this hotel is not even worth $200/night. I would definately recommend the Marriott or the Westin at Copley Place. The only positive I found in the hotel was the location. It is located right by a beautiful garden/park.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want a comfortable night”
Reviews.Author: egnarocatom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights and found the bed unbearable. A cheap comforter with no cover on top and a lumpy feather comforter under the bottom sheet. Also, bizarrely, housekeeping threw out two bottles of water and the newly delivered free newspaper when we had our room cleaned. The front desk staff were fairly miserable but the other staff were really great and helpful. Otherwise, it is what it is, an olde worlde stuffy traditional hotel that could use some renovations. Great location and views.

Reviews.Title: “Taj is great”
Reviews.Author: shirleymsacks
Reviews.Content: A fantastic room overlooking the park. Lovely quiet service. Old style graciousness. Nice to have use of the Executive Floor for snacks, though they did take there away somewhat quickly when the time was over. Comfortable beds and linens. I'd stay there for sure again,

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: guy r
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully located, the hotel is very luxurious and the room was very comfortable and well decorated. The staff is very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Under-delivered!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel79
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 month old son and I stayed here for 4 nights for a quick getaway. The Taj is definitely not a 5 star hotel. The property is old and it shows. Our room (a 1 bedroom suite) required maintenance. The carpet was dirty and worn out. The bed skirt was filthy. The bathroom is small. The front desk/concierge took several calls for them to answer and the lounge has no access for strollers or wheelchairs. On the positive side, the hotel's location is ideal and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great old place”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: stayed here while it was the Ritz Carlton, we were upgraded to a suite from a room and it was beautiful and classic Ritz! The casual dinner in the Cafe was great as was afternoon tea in the French Lounge. Right on Newbury Street for shopping and the public garden. I would defiantly go back and hope that Taj have kept it up!

Reviews.Title: “High Class Hotel but a little bit to formal”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: This is the former Ritz Carlton Hotel. It is a high class premium hotel and the service is from A to Z absolutely perfect. The TAJ Chain wants to promote the fact of this kind of premium, palast like service and I am sure they have customers that go for that. personally, I think it is a little bit to formal, but again, expectations are different. if you are looking for a high class location in Boston, then you definitively are going to be happy if you select this hotel. If you want to go for business or if you want just to have a great location for visiting Boston, then I think another location would be more appropriate. The Restaurant is fantastic, the Bar.... ok... there are more fun places to have a beer then in that Bar. But again, tasts are different.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTorontonian
Reviews.Content: The Taj Boston is situated in the heart of the city. It's conveniently located across from the Public Gardens/Boston Commons, walking distance to Beacon Hill and right on Newbury Street. This was our first family vacation with our three year old and was a little concerned. We stayed here for three nights and continued on to Martha's Vineyard. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly door man who helped bring in our bags. Check in was smooth and efficient. The hotel was very accommodating by setting us up with a microwave, fridge and DVD player at no extra charge making it very convenient to travel with a young child. What impressed us most, having checked in late, we realized we didn't have milk for our son for bed time. We took a chance and asked the restaurant for a cup of milk; they pleasantly provided us the milk and did not charge for it. Traveling with a child, we booked a room with two double beds. The room and bathroom was spacious and clean and overlooked the Commonwealth with a partial view of the Public Garden. The hotel supplied bottled water and chocolates with turn down service. Umbrella's are available and can be found either in the room or with the door man. In addition, the hotel had a stroller available; this came in handy during the Freedom Trail walk. Concierge was very helpful suggesting restaurants, etc.. Valet parking is convenient but pricey - although typical for hotels located within the city. Overall, we received excellent service and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: katandjohn
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful concierge staff, however, this is not a 5 star hotel. First of all, the hallway looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in months. It was filthy and disgusting to walk on. There is not enough sound proofing so it was very noisy. You can hear voices from other rooms easily, and doors slamming at all hours of the night. The most disturbing occurence was the fact that we requested a nonsmoking room yet there were strong smoke scents coming from somewhere and our room wreaked of cigarette smoke. My eyes were burning horribly from the smoke in the middle of the night, so we had to move rooms. There were only slight and unmeaningful verbal apologies, but for a 5 star hotel, they should have accomodated us pleasurably for everything we put up with. Very dissappointing. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Laura090
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was pleased with the Taj. The location can't be beat. It was right next to good shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing. The room was large and clean enough, although a bit run down. I understand though that they are about to start remodeling it. The staff was helpful and friendly. I would definately consider staying there again, primarily because of the location. Only this time I would request a view of the Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with Boston and grew to love the Taj too”
Reviews.Author: CJAustin
Reviews.Content: What I loved: Location cannot be beat. Perfectly nestled between Bostonâ€™s prettiest streets for walking/ shopping / eating and just across the street from the Public Garden Bath products Bedding Furnishings in our suite Lobby flowers Coffee and pastries in the lobby in the early morning The robe. Like a snuggly throw blanket. The towels. Huge, fluffy bath sheets and plenty of them! Views of the Public Gardens from the club lounge Doormen and concierge became friendlier and friendlier during our stay What I didnâ€™t love: My junior suite bedroom shared a wall with the elevator shaft. Room service took over an hour and the clam chowder made me sick (Boston has so much good food nearby â€“ skip room service) Nothing special to welcome children like the Ritz has always done At first I was a little irritated with The Taj, but after a five day stay, I fell in love with the hotel just as much as I fell in love with Boston. My room was a disappointment and traveling with a three-year old, I didnâ€™t want to hassle with a change. I booked a junior suite on the club level and got a beautifully appointed room BUT it was next to the elevator shaft on the floor BELOW the club level (defeats the convenience of the lounge!) Unless you fall asleep instantly, donâ€™t book this room because the elevator noise will ruin your night. Also, â€œthe tranquil garden viewâ€� is a look of windows and walls between the red brick buildings. Book a room with a view and you wonâ€™t be disappointed! If I went back, Iâ€™d stay here again, but Iâ€™d book a room with a view of the Public Gardens even if it wasnâ€™t a suite. Also, if youâ€™re on the fence about staying on the club level and you have small children, skip it. Children were tolerated, but unwelcome in the lounge. We made our trips to the club lounge for cheerios and cookies very short. Also, the drink setup is not typical Ritz indulgence as concierge staff serves you making you wait a bit for champagne or water or whatever. I saw some people leave after waiting too long for a cocktail. While the club food looked good and was plentiful, I preferred eating out for local crab cakes, lobster rolls, cod and chowders. Boston is such a delicious locale that the desire to eat on the club level was not the same as other destinations. But I still believe club access is a good value and nice splurge if you partake in cocktails. The location and building is the best and among the most beautiful in the city, but I think the Four Seasons might be a nice alternative and also the Fairmont Copley Plaza. If you have a view of the Public Gardens and appreciate the historic value of the Taj, I think youâ€™ll enjoy it! What a treasure Boston is. I canâ€™t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Quick Trip”
Reviews.Author: wmac75
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston on business and stayed one night with my daughter who lives in Boston. Great location, easy pull up and drop your car off for valet parking. Convenient, quick check in and very courteous service. Great bright colored room with wonderful old architectural details. Fabulous Boston garden view and at night the skyline is spectacular. Had a higher floor and well worth the extra cost. The bath products were wonderful and breakfast was a bit pricey but delicious. All the service was tremendous and the hotel is a great place to stay. Very convenient to restaurants, Newberry Street and just taking a walk. The T is right around the corner and a couple quick stops to Fenway. Had to pay $11 for internet service but they said wifi coming in August. Speed of the internet was quick though. Great selection on in-room movies but at cost of $11 each. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: swelch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a wedding and had a lovely stay. The location is phenomenal in the heart of Back Bay and our room had a great view of the Public Garden. Be sure to ask for a room with a view. I found the staff attentive and friendly. Check in and checkout were easy. As some others have reported, the hotel is a bit dated, though I found everything to be clean and well maintained. If you like classic styles, you'll be happy. If modern is your thing, book somewhere else. My one real complaint is that the bathroom was TINY- barely enough room for a tub, sink and toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Taj Boston”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spontaneously booked the Taj, litererally, last minute via hotels.com. We were eating lunch on Boylston Street and decided we wanted to stay in the city for the evening...While at lunch we used the trusty iPhone and had our stay booked at the Taj, 5 minutes later we walked around the corner and checked in at this beautiful, landmark establishment. Check in was smooth and I was shocked that having booked so last minute that there was no problem with the reservation. Our room was fantastic. It was very spacious, with a large marble bath, king bed, 2 lovely chairs, large desk, ect. We didn't have much of a view, but that really didn't matter to us anyway. It was refreshing to stay at hotel with true historic charm and character, without sacrificing luxury at all. Service for the most part was excellent with the exception of housekeeping opening the door at 9am barely after the first knock. Nice touches included turndown service (as expected), shoe shine, and complimentary umbrellas in your closet (glad we didn't need it!). We ordered late night room service and it was very good, a little on the slow side, but nothing to complain about. Overall, we loved the Taj and definately will go back. It was fun to spontaneously stay at such a beautiful establishment and the location (right on the Boston Common) is spectacular. We definately will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yellow Bee
Reviews.Content: Business trip to Boston at the Taj. Our room was clean and was fine for one night. Bathroom is small but because it's an older hotel that was the way they were built. We were on the 9th floor with a great view of the public garden. Lobby is very small with very few chairs for sitting. A short walk to everything. Newberry Street shopping is right out the front door. Staff seemed helpful but we were not there long enough to really have much contact with them. Evening turn down service was nice. Robes in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Taste of Boston at the Taj!”
Reviews.Author: tman327
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I use Trip Advisor constantly for all of my business and personal trips. I travel quite frequently, so I know what constitutes a good hotel, and this one was great! Pros: LOCATION: it is right smack dab in the middle of the action at downtown Boston. It is directly across the street from the beautiful Boston Gardens/Commons Area. The surrounding streets are littered with shopping, fine restaurants, beautiful architecture. The original Cheers is a 5 minute walk. SERVICE: from arrival to departure the service is top notch! ARCHITECTURE/ROOMS: the building itself is beautiful, and the rooms are also very beautiful and well appointed. The bathrooms are tastefully done in Marble. Be sure to ask for a room that faces the Boston Gardens/Commons park area. It is absolutely magnificent. THE CITY: Boston is a wonderful city. This was my first trip there, and you can explore all of downtown Boston from this hotel. It is all within walking distance. Even the harbors/marinas are only a 30-45 minute walk. The city is beautiful, clean, safe. I even rode their subways at midnight with NO Safety Concerns! Cons: THE PRICE: I stayed here on business, so I was not paying for the Hotel, but it is rather pricey. But you get what you pay for. As noted above, it has many things going for it in regards to Pros, so if you want to experience the beauty and history of downtown Boston, then book this hotel. It will be worth the price. THE TV: although a relatively minor concern, in a fancy hotel like this one would expect the tv's to be a little more upscale, ie...flatscreens, lcd, plasma, etc.....but they are the good old big tube 20-24 inchers. I spent virtually no time watching TV while there, but it was rather odd and out of place in a hotel like this. If you have any specific questions let me know, I would be happy to help out!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: mndnyc
Reviews.Content: someone needs to put some money into this hotel. Rooms are really tired. Bathrooms are old ...particularly in the "new" wing. This was one of the old Ritz Carltons in town and they did not do a very good renovation and the new owners have done nothing. Plus the halls are dirty...I have never seen such filth in the hallways of a hotel...like I was staying in a construction zone.

Reviews.Title: “Fell short!”
Reviews.Author: andiamo
Reviews.Content: Booked our "club" room for our 25th anniversary, directly with the hotel (for 6 nights)...and 2 months in advance! On arrival April 10, we were placed in a room next to the tiny kitchen of the club lounge...which looks over the gardens. Didn't think much of the small room and the "ridiculously small, one person" bathroom, but the following morning, with the noise of the kitchen (which is understandable ), we asked to move to another location. This was done, keeping our beautiful garden view on the 12th floor and our club level access. That night I woke and could smell a "sewer" type odor coming from the bathroom. The next morning I notified housekeeping and hoped that "something" would be fixed while gone for the day. All seemed fine on our return, until that night and into the next day! The same situation. I again contacted housekeeping and they contacted engineering! No smell on our return....but that night and continuing throughout the day, the same thing. The following morning I spoke to a hotel manger. He assured me that the problem would be "taken care of". In short, it wasn't and sadly, after a trip and hotel I couldn't wait to experience......I couldn't wait to leave! After staying in some of the finest hotels throughout the USA & Europe, I found this situation adsurb. I may just contact the GM of the Boston Taj....or maybe they"ll contact me, as I did inform the front desk staff before our 5:45 AM departure!

Reviews.Title: “Pinnacle”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdfan
Reviews.Content: For me, this hotel ranks as one of the very best I have ever stayed in anywhere. It happens I also got an amazing rate. But, even at their rack rates, everything about the place (except, I must note, its lobby, which does not have much sitting-and-people-watching space) is top class. The staff does all it can to anticipate and fulfill needs. The room was large, very well appointed with large windows, and had an excellent bathroom with Moulton Brown amenities. The bar had a blazing fireplace (much appreciated in the cold springtime), a cozy, clubby atmosphere complete with pianist, superb martinis shaken and poured tableside, and good nibbles. Restaurant prices were high. This is a marvelous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Fireplace Room”
Reviews.Author: lavacek
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the TAJ. The hotel is the former Ritz-Carlton. It is still the Ritz as far as I'm concerned. We booked on the hotel website, and got a great rate of $ 189 for Wed and Thurs, and $ 169 Fri and Sat. It was our anniversary, and I emailed and called the hotel to let them know. On arrival we found a bottle of champagne and chocolates, and a heart of rose petals on our bed. It was a very thoughful touch. Our room, 604, had a working fireplace! We had a fireplace menu (complimentary), and could order up different types of wood, oak, cherry, birch or maple. The fireplace butlers were very nice and very prompt. We enjoyed our fireplace every night. We room was very spacious and the bed great. We only had breakfast one morning as we were at a conference most of the time. The breakfast service was excellent. The hotel is ina great location at the top of Newbery Street. The Boston Common is acros the street. Overall it was a great stay at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “best in boston”
Reviews.Author: statement96
Reviews.Content: incredible stay, nicer now than when it was the ritz - less stuffy and more comfortable, extremely friendly fast check-in and staff, super comfortable beds w/turndown service, robes, slippers, large tubs, exercise room is three times bigger in size than most city hotel gyms...highly recommended hotel chain....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Taj”
Reviews.Author: NattyD01
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Taj was a great experience, the location is fabulous, food amazing. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend the taj”
Reviews.Author: ilovenyc
Reviews.Content: perfect location, great service....The hotel sits right on the edge of boston commons and at the end of newbury street for great shopping. close to copley square for more shopping. We arrived at noon, check in is at 3pm, they upgraded our room since they had one facing commonwealth ave available. Room size was very large and clean. We called concierge for dinner recommendation. Davio's 2 blocks away was amazing. Breakfast downstairs in the morning was wonderful as well. I would stay here again in a heart beat. Great find.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Ever After Management Change to Taj!”
Reviews.Author: NoYahoo
Reviews.Content: Returning to this property for the first time after the change in ownership from Ritz-Carlton to Taj, we were not only pleasantly surprised, but the property is better than ever. Due to late booking, we could not get our preferred location facing Commonwealth Avenue in the "new" section. These rooms, and especially the bathrooms, are larger than the rooms in the "old" wing facing Newbury Street. While the view over the Public Garden is beautiful, I've never thought it was worth $100 a night extra. Room sizes are similar to above "new" and "old" wings detailed above even facing the Public Garden. This being said, our room overlooking Newbury Street in the "old" wing was flawless with not one chip of paint. Best mattress in a hotel in years, bathroom is small for two people with make up, razors etc., but certainly passable. What is incredible is the instant hot water, great shower pressure, soap, shampoo etc. Nightly turndown and towel change flawless as was the maid service. Bathrobes sized at L/XL were way too large for my 5'1' spouse and no other sizes were available. Hopefully, they will correct this. Great staff! Snafu with sending over the wrong car was settled by taking the $42 a night parking charge off the bill. From the Cafe, front desk and one of the world's best bars, all I can stay is outstanding! This has been and will remain our "Boston" home. The newer Ritz on the other side of the Common, for out tastes, is just that; common. Now in its 80th year, the Grand Dame of Boston is better than ever!

Reviews.Title: “OK but boutique or B&B better”
Reviews.Author: Hcwr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty good but considering the class it is in, I expected more. They foyer is lovely and the location excellent. The staff at the check in were efficient but slightly perfunctory. The room smelt a bit of smoke. All in all, I would go for one of the boutique hotels next time if they have room. The big hotels like this just don't seem to be as friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews indicate..”
Reviews.Author: londonbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: Having read the views on the board I was slightly apprehensive about having made this booking. Not least because it was a family holiday. We booked a suite and were impressed with the size of it and also the way it was furnished. A little old school. As others have said a little old school (think Waldorf Astoria/Essex House in NYC) but actually charming for all that. Perfect location for families from every perspective. Safe, next to Boston Common, central etc. Very good rom service too. Good place and better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Skier235
Reviews.Content: Read some of the less positive reviews of this hotel prior to booking, but since most hotels were completely booked, and I got a good rate, decided to try it. Was very impressed. Room was spacious (king overlooking park), very quiet, and well appointed. Bath towels were very soft 60" bath sheets (not standard in hyatt or westin). Service was very good. Great location across street from Park. Only complaint is that the A/C was on too high when I checked in. There was a thermostat on wall, which I turned down, but it didnt have any temperature markings. Not easy to figure out how much to turn it down to get the temperature right. I didnt eat any meals in hotel, but noted that prices seemed high.

Reviews.Title: “Service Out of this World”
Reviews.Author: augievikings1992
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at Taj Boston for a seminar. The service at this hotel is magnificent. I don't think I have ever had better service - concierage is great, housekeeping great etc. Every staff person I have come into contact with (even on the elevator) has been friendly and concerned about whether I am enjoying my stay. The health club is also very nice - two elliptical machines, 6 treadmills, free weights, weight machines, etc. I am in a suite that is very nice, although the carpet and furnishings are definitely showing their age. Carpet has several stains and the walls could use a fresh coat of paint. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The proxmity to the shopping and restaurants on Newbury Street is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: NewYork2
Reviews.Content: At first I was under-whelmed by the hotel â€“ service, dÃ©cor, old fashioned tvâ€™s, ambiance etc. From there, things got worse. I turned out my light to go to sleep at 12:30 and was kept awake by an annoying buzz outside my window (I was facing Newbury Street). I called the front desk to inquire about the noise but was told by an unfriendly, unhelpful operator that she didnâ€™t know what I was talking about or what this noise could be. I hung up, opened the curtains and the window to see a large yellow van parked right in front of the hotel. There was tubing running from the van into the lobby and a generator running by the van (which was making this awful noise). I called the front desk again to inform that operator about the source of the noise (which of course she must have known at the time of my first call). She just said â€œohâ€�. I asked if she could find out how long the generator would be running. She put me on hold and then came back with â€œthree hoursâ€�. There was no suggestion about how she could make my situation better. I asked to speak with a manager and to be moved to another room. I was moved (to a much nicer, larger room on the common side of the hotel). When I checked out, nobody asked how my stay was and I received no compensation for the disruption. Overall, I was NOT impressed with this hotel. What kind of hotel operator runs a generator in front of the hotel for 4 hours during the night? This felt like an incredibly poorly run hotel â€“ certainly not 4-5 star level service. I have had better service at a holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Sad End to a Once Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaraSue
Reviews.Content: A native Bostonian, I have great memories of this hotel when it was the Ritz. I had heard wonderful things about the Taj chain and was excited to stay here. What a disappointment. We paid extra to assure a room with two double beds. Upon checking in at 4:30 in the afternoon, we were told that no double rooms were available. We were forced to wait in the lobby for over a half an hour while they found a room for us (even though the desk staff told us it would only be five minutes). Even though there was a bellman just hanging around the lobby, no one could be bothered to help with luggage. While the room was spacious, the bathroom definitely needed some attention, seeing as there was mold growing in the shower and along the floor. There are much nicer, cleaner and less expensive hotels in Boston that provide exceptional and courteous service. Needless to say, I will not be staying at the Taj again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: workandplay8
Reviews.Content: The Good: excellent service, great beds, great location, excellent linens. The Bad: smallish rooms, expensive restaurant (goes with the neighborhood), a little out of the way from the metro, small bathrooms. Nice details like chocolates, reading materials, too-small slippers, evening room turn-downs, and blue crystal water glasses add to the charm. Worth it if you can get a good rate, not worth it at full price. Would be so much better if they decorated it with the interiors from their luxury palace hotels in India rather than keep it 'American'.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: This is a grand old hotel, with the accent on old. If you've ever stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, you'll get the picture quickly. The good news is that this place finally stopped pretending that it is up to the 21st Century standards for a Ritz Carlton property. They try to make up for their shortcomings with their service, but that only goes so far. I have stayed here twice in recent months. The rooms are well-appointed, but their size, and the size of the bathrooms can vary dramatically. It is in a fantastic location, at the foot of Newbury in the Back Bay. There are many restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: EllenStratford_CT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed only one night and were sorry to leave. Service was excellent - warm and polished, as was everything in the hotel; stayed in a junior suite that was loaded with charm (I'm sick to death of minimalist & art deco furnishings) den-like bar was great for relaxing and conversation, and the location between Commonwealth and Newbury facing the Common can't be topped!

Reviews.Title: “Old and Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: point579
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Taj Boston in May 2007. This hotel is at a great location in Boston, just opposite the Boston Commons and right on the Newbury Street. However the entire hotel including the rooms is very old and stuffy and needs immediate renovation. The breakfast menu is a joke. I really liked the room service though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dtor
Reviews.Content: May 7 2007 - The Taj Boston Mass. Having read a few negative reports about this hotel (formerly the Ritz -Carton) I was pleasantly surprised. The accomodations of a standard room king bed where very large - definitly over 360 ' sq. The bed needed a step stool to get into it, and although my room was without a view of the Boston Commons it was very comfrotable. The service at the hotel was impeccable with very friendly accomodating staff. The location is amazing as you step out onto Newbury Street, he swan lake in the Boston Commons, a subway stop a block away, fantastic restaurants, pubs, shopping. I would reccomend that if you stay, you make sure that a refurbished room is available. The new managemanet is beginning its update of the hotel which is a little tired looking at the moment. I found the price of 326 a night on par for a major convention city. The negatives - the lack of seating in the lobby....you cannot sit and read a paper. The bar is very lovely and tends toward an older trendy crowd. The business center has only two computers - rather small. This is a great hotel for older travelers, business travelers. A little stuffy for singles and families.

Reviews.Title: “poor service for price”
Reviews.Author: graada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in end of april and paid $250/night. The service was quite bad on our first night and there are few amenities considering how expensive it is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, especially for its age.”
Reviews.Author: SuaSignoria
Reviews.Content: Our entire stay was delightful. As an older building, the hotel is very well kept, and the older style wide hallways are very nice. Overall, the service was excellent; however, the person who checked us in at the front desk tried to be friendly, but should have been more distant and professional. The bell staff was on-the-whole unsatisfactory, having forgotten to collect our bags when asked, and having been generally less than absolutely helpful. The hotel also lacks a pool, and has no arrangement for guests to use one in the immediate vicinity. Our room was very nice, the buiness center was useful, and the concierge was also very helpful. The location and heritage are enough to justify a stay, but the Taj definitely stands on its own merits.

HotelInfo.Name: Taj Boston
HotelInfo.Address: 15 Arlington Street, Boston, MA 02116 (Formerly Ritz-Carlton Boston)
